Txt_Item_Flavor_Copper_Sword.Text: Not the flashiest of swords by any means, but it gets the job done.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Steel_Broadsword.Text: The perfect choice for those ready to take their sword skills to the next level.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Slapstick.Text: Bonk an enemy on the head with this and you'll be treated to a feast for the ears.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Orochis_Sword.Text: One of Jipang's greatest treasures. This sword can lower a group of enemies' defence when used as an item in battle.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Zombiesbane.Text: Few swords strike such fear into the very still hearts of the undead.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Mountaincleaver.Text: Capable of shifting the very earth itself; this blade is truly the stuff of legend.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Dragonsbane.Text: Look no further than these scale-slicing claws if you're facing an enemy from the dragon family.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Thunderbolt_Blade.Text: Unleashes booming blasts on all enemies when used as an item in battle.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Siren_Sword.Text: Conjures a murky mist that can confuse an enemy when used as an item in battle.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Sword_Of_Ruin.Text: Few swords are so capable of critical hits, but its brilliance comes at a cost: whoever wields it is inevitably cursed.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Blizzard_Blade.Text: Assaults a group of enemies with razor-sharp icicles when used as an item in battle.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Sword_Of_Kings.Text: This stately sword sends a shockwave hurtling towards a group of enemies when used as an item in battle.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Falcon_Blade.Text: Allows the wielder to deal a double slice faster than a falcon on the wing.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Bastard_Sword.Text: Favoured by all kinds of adventurers for its clean-cutting blade.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Stormlords_Sword.Text: This almighty blade burns a group of enemies to a crisp when used as an item in battle.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Double-Edged_Sword.Text: As the name implies, this cursed weapon is so mighty that it damages both foe and wielder alike.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Rubisss_Sword.Text: Blessed by Rubiss, this sacred sword strikes down all foes with bolts from the heavens when used as an item in battle.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Iron_Axe.Text: A sturdy axe forged from iron.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Battleaxe.Text: For axe aficionados who crave a weapon that's on the sharper side.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Headsmans_Axe.Text: Just as likely to land a critical hit as it is to miss entirely. Best wait to wield this till you're feeling lucky.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Conquerors_Axe.Text: Once favoured by a savage king, you won't find many axes that deal more damage than this.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Iron_Lance.Text: A fairly standard iron lance. Perfect for beginners.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Holy_Lance.Text: Made from a metal ever so special and imbued with divine energy.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Battle_Fork.Text: Once a farming tool, this tremendously long trident was tweaked to pack a punch on the battlefield.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Sandstorm_Spear.Text: A spear that sends sand to bedazzle a group of enemies when used as an item in battle.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Demon_Spear.Text: This fiendish spear can take out its target in one hit if it strikes them in the right spot.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Godly_Poker.Text: This spear's strength is the stuff of legend. Don't waste your time searching for one mightier than it.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Bronze_Knife.Text: A basic bronze knife. Does what it says on the tin.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Divine_Dagger.Text: Made from the purest silver, this lightweight dagger won't let you down in a fight.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Poison_Needle.Text: Can slay a baddy with one poke if it happens to hit the right spot.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Assassins_Dagger.Text: Loved by assassins as it sometimes defeats a target with one slash; some wish it were more consistent though.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Iron_Claws.Text: A reliable pair of sharp claws forged from iron.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Golden_Claws.Text: Don't be tricked by these claws' shiny appearance, they're cursed as anything.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Knuckledusters.Text: These claws are a bit on the heavy side, but they're worth their weight in gold in battle, and adored by martial artists.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Fire_Claws.Text: These claws send fire flying towards a baddy when used as an item in battle.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Dragon_Claws.Text: Nearly as sharp as a dragon's teeth, there's not much these claws can't cut through.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Beast_Claws.Text: Made from the spiky sections of a scary specimen, these claws come into their own against beast-family enemies.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Orichalcum_Claws.Text: Foes rarely get the chance to feast their eyes on these fetching claws before they're cut down by them.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Wizards_Staff.Text: Sends a ball of fire hurtling towards a baddy when used as an item in battle.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Rune_Staff.Text: Those who are able to wield this staff are well on their way to becoming bona fide magic users.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Staff_Of_Antimagic.Text: A sceptre that can be used as an item in battle to stop a group of enemies from casting spells.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Somatic_Staff.Text: A special staff that drains its master's MP in exchange for giving their attack a beefy boost.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Staff_Of_Sentencing.Text: This sacred sceptre can unleash a gust of wind on a group of enemies when used as an item in battle.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Lightning_Staff.Text: Unleashes a flurry of flames on a group of enemies when used as an item in battle.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Snooze_Stick.Text: Lulls a group of enemies to sleep when used as an item in battle.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Staff_Of_Rain.Text: Rain clouds envelop a group of enemies, stopping them from casting spells, when this is used as an item in battle.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Sages_Staff.Text: The sage who crafted this was clearly a cut above the rest; heals allies' wounds when used as an item in battle.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Staff_Of_Strife.Text: Forms a burly barrier of light around an ally that deflects spells when used as an item in battle.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Staff_Of_Resurrection.Text: As you might expect, this nifty staff can be used as an item in battle to resurrect fallen allies.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Godbird_Sceptre.Text: A fearsome staff that summons forth a giant ball of fire to burn an enemy when used as an item in battle.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Aurora_Staff.Text: Removes all beneficial effects from all enemies when used as an item in battle.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Abracadabracus.Text: An abacus in a past life, this handy piece of kit is now a weapon wielded exclusively by merchants.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Astraeas_Abacus.Text: Thought to be the stuff of legend. This abacus may only be wielded by those who toil away for the greater good.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Chain_Sickle.Text: No one's worked out yet if this is a sickle with a chain on the end, or a chain with a sickle on the end.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Thorn_Whip.Text: This thorny thong can hit a whole bunch of baddies at once.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Chain_Whip_Items.Text: Made of pure silver, this wonderful whip can lash a whole line of enemies at once.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Beastly_Bullwhip.Text: Best used against burly beast-family enemies.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Spiked_Steel_Whip.Text: A prickly piece of gear that can hit multiple foes at once.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Dragontail_Whip.Text: Deals decent damage to enemies from the dragon family.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Scourge_Whip.Text: A wicked whip that lashes foes with furious force.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Empresss_Whip.Text: Favoured by an empress of old, this fearsome thong is particularly powerful against humanoid-family enemies.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Gringham_Whip.Text: This peculiar lash takes on a life of its own when wielded by a true whip warrior.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Destructiball.Text: One of the best ways to inflict profound pain on a group of unlucky baddies.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Boomerang.Text: Crafted from a suitably sturdy tree, beginners need look no further than this boomerang.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Edged_Boomerang.Text: Gives you that extra edge you'll need to take down your enemies.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Gusterang.Text: A throwing stick imbued with the wind's energy.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Swallowtail.Text: Its avian design isn't just for show, this boomerang is extra effective against insect-family enemies.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Metal_Wing_Boomerang.Text: Keep this handy if you think you might be facing some metallic menaces.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Hunters_Moon.Text: Slices through everything in its path like moonlight through a starry sky.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Cypress_Stick.Text: A no-frills standard stick carved from the wood of a cypress tree.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Oaken_Club.Text: Fairly rudimentary, but it gets the job done.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Morning_Star.Text: Ideal for giving a whole group of enemies a rude awakening.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Sledgehammer.Text: The added spikes allow this meaty mallet to deal even more damage.

Txt_Item_Flavor_War_Hammer.Text: A colossal hammer that's perfect for turning baddies into pancakes.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Sizeable_Scissors.Text: It's all over for any enemy unlucky enough to find themselves between these two blades.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Pot_Lid.Text: A charming, if basic, makeshift shield.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Leather_Shield.Text: Look too closely and you'll realise this is little more than some leather stretched over lumber.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Scale_Shield.Text: A protective plate adorned with some solid scales.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Bronze_Shield.Text: Not the flashiest of shields, but it won't let you down in a fight.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Silver_Platter.Text: Whoever made this probably didn't plan for it to serve as a shield, but needs must.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Iron_Shield.Text: A beefy buckler made of iron.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Light_Shield.Text: Give this shield a go if you find others are weighing you down.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Ice_Shield.Text: A frosty buckler that protects against fiery attacks and spells.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Magic_Shield.Text: A mystical shield that protects against offensive spells.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Dragon_Shield.Text: A solid plate of dragon hide that protects against fire and ice breath attacks.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Tempest_Shield.Text: Sporting a face you won't forget in a hurry, this shield protects against explosive spells.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Flame_Shield.Text: A red-hot shield that protects against ice attacks and spells.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Silver_Shield.Text: The centrepiece that adorns this beautiful buckler was apparently inspired by a serene lake.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Mirror_Shield.Text: The mysterious mirror found on this shield sometimes reflects spells.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Power_Shield.Text: A special shield that can heal an ally's wounds when used as an item in battle.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Ogre_Shield.Text: Frankly, even an ogre would struggle to wield this supersized shield.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Heros_Shield.Text: An undying symbol of heroism through the ages, this shield protects against fire and ice attacks.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Shield_Of_Shame.Text: Lessens the pain felt from any attacks that hit the wielder, but dumps the brunt of the damage on an ally.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Goddess_Shield.Text: A sacred shield that protects against a whole host of spells and attacks, including those of a fiery and icy nature.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Leather_Hat.Text: Keeps the sun off the wearer's head and not much else.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Turban.Text: A hardy headcloth that does a decent job of protecting the wearer.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Feathered_Cap.Text: The quickest way to add a few feathers to your cap.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Hardwood_Headwear.Text: This helm doesn't just resemble a tree trunk, it's made from one too.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Fur_Hood.Text: An ideal choice for cold winter nights.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Scholars_Cap.Text: Popular with those who like to appear smarter than they actually are.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Iron_Helmet.Text: A ubiquitous helm forged from iron.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Black_Bandana.Text: A surefire way for the wearer to hide almost all of their face.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Hermes_Hat.Text: Handy headwear that protects against wind spells.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Pointy_Hat.Text: A little piece of headgear with a charming tapered tip.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Iron_Mask.Text: This iron helm protects the wearer's entire head at the cost of limiting their vision.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Ortegas_Helm.Text: A great helm given to a great hero just before the day of his departure.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Mask_Of_Implacability.Text: Protects the wearer far better than any other mask, but does require them to put up with an inconvenient curse.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Top_Hat.Text: Made from the finest silk going, this hat can transform even the blandest of outfits.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Mad_Cap.Text: A helpful hat that reduces the amount of MP needed to cast spells.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Phantom_Mask.Text: Allows the wearer to avoid more enemy attacks than usual.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Bunny_Ears.Text: Gives the wearer an idea of what life might be like as a rabbit.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Thiefs_Turban.Text: A length of cloth that felons wear to hide their faces.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Raging_Bull_Helm.Text: Horned headwear that will have anyone who dons it raring to charge.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Hapless_Helm.Text: Horrid headgear that curses its wearer to a lifetime lacking in luck.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Mythril_Helm.Text: A sought-after helm made from a mythical metal.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Thinking_Cap.Text: A curious crown said to improve the intelligence of anyone who wears it.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Great_Helm.Text: Made from a magical metal that's stronger than steel.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Light_Helm.Text: A piece of holy headwear forged from zenithium.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Star_Circlet.Text: This sparkling headband lowers the chances of the wearer having their spells sealed away, or their MP drained.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Duplic_Hat.Text: Allows the wearer to occasionally cast the same spell twice in a row.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Heavenly_Helm.Text: A helm from on high that protects against confusion, bedazzlement, poisoning and averts insta-death.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Plain_Clothes.Text: The go-to choice for anyone not terribly fussed with fashion.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Wayfarers_Clothes.Text: Hardy attire made of hessian for those who spend plenty of time on the roads.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Leather_Armour.Text: Lightweight armour that can be relied upon against run-of-the-mill foes.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Training_Togs.Text: The freedom of movement afforded by this outfit makes it a favourite with martial artists everywhere.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Tortoise_Shell.Text: A solid suit of armour that gets the job done, but lays waste to the wearer's fashion credentials.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Shell_Armour.Text: An ever-so-slightly more fashion-friendly attempt at crafting armour from reptile shells.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Chain_Mail.Text: Lightweight armour made from countless loops linked together.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Iron_Apron.Text: A burly breastplate that weighs down the wearer.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Leather_Cape.Text: Crafted from the hide of a beast with bad luck.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Boxer_Shorts.Text: Unfortunate underclothes which exude an air of despair...or maybe that's just sweat.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Sparring_Suit.Text: Togs tailored for martial artists to do battle in.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Iron_Armour.Text: Weighty armour that provides plenty of protection.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Cloak_Of_Evasion.Text: A curious piece of clothing that allows the wearer to avoid more enemy attacks than usual.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Leather_Kilt.Text: Made from a hodge-podge of different beast hides.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Leather_Dress.Text: A no-nonsense frock made of animal hide.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Magical_Skirt.Text: A flashy garment that reduces damage from enemy spells.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Black_Pyjamas.Text: The ideal sneaking suit for anyone who needs to take care of business without being seen.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Silk_Robe.Text: Weaved from the finest silk money can buy.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Full_Plate_Armour.Text: A suit of solid steel that keeps the wearer from harm.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Fur_Vest.Text: A warm little number that reduces damage from fire and ice attacks.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Fizzle_Retardant_Suit.Text: Beloved by conjurers all over, this superb suit often protects the wearer from having their spells sealed away.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Magical_Robes.Text: A firm favourite with conjurers, this cloak reduces damage from offensive enemy magic.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Magic_Armour.Text: Enchanted armour that reduces damage from enemy spells.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Party_Dress.Text: The quickest way to be the belle of any ball.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Smart_Suit.Text: Dashing duds that can only be pulled off by those exuding confidence.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Wizards_Robe.Text: Conjurer's clothes of old that help protect the wearer from having their spells sealed away.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Silver_Cuirass.Text: A beefy breastplate made of silver.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Garish_Garb.Text: A feast for the eyes that can only be donned by a true gadabout.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Agility_Gilet.Text: Comfy clothing that's easy to move around in.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Earthenwear.Text: A suit of armour that's at least as hard as a rock.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Cat_Suit.Text: Fabulous feline-themed duds that allow the wearer to live out their dream of being a kitty.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Stealth_Suit.Text: There can't be an outfit out there that's easier to sneak about in than this one.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Angels_Robe.Text: Heavenly robes that protect the wearer from spells which would normally be fatal.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Epic_Apron.Text: This excellent apron reduces the damage taken from enemy spells.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Spiked_Armour.Text: Sends damage dealt by enemy attacks right back to the source.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Dragon_Dojo_Duds.Text: Martial artist attire that reduces damage taken from fire and ice attacks.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Dragon_Mail.Text: Crafted from countless dragon scales, this armour reduces damage taken from fire spells and breath attacks.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Infernal_Armour.Text: This vexing armour reduces damage taken from enemy spells, but sometimes paralyses the wearer.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Scandalous_Swimsuit.Text: For those who think the fun of the fight is in strutting their stuff.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Flame_Armour.Text: This red-hot suit reduces damage from enemy ice attacks and spells.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Flowing_Dress.Text: A holy frock that reduces damage from fire, ice and explosive attacks.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Bandit_Mail.Text: Odd armour forged from an unknown ore.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Auroral_Armour.Text: A sacred suit of armour that reduces damage from fire and ice attacks whilst also healing the wearer while they walk.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Magic_Bikini.Text: Some say this bikini is imbued with magic such is the unusual level of protection it provides.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Dragon_Robe.Text: This serpentine clothing reduces damage from fire and ice attacks.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Shimmering_Dress.Text: A frock most fabulous that reduces damage from enemy magic as well as fire and ice attacks.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Blessed_Bikini.Text: Superb swimwear that heals the wearer while they walk.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Dark_Robe.Text: Just the right hue to make avoiding enemy attacks that bit easier.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Glombolero.Text: This curious garment halves the amount of MP used to cast spells.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Corsairs_Coat.Text: Worn by seafarers, this coat reduces damage taken from enemy wind spells.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Yggdrasil_Dress_Coat.Text: This coat of auld lowers the chances of its wearer becoming confused, having their spells sealed away or their MP drained.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Godbird_Robe.Text: Through mysterious means this robe reduces the amount of MP needed to cast spells.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Exotoga.Text: This garment's lucky wearer takes less damage from spells, and is less likely to be affected by poison, paralysis and sleep.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Godbird_Armour.Text: Reflects half the damage done by physical attacks and gradually heals the wearer's wounds.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Strength_Ring.Text: Gives the wearer's inner <b>meathead</> a beefy boost. It goes on your finger, by the way.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Tough_Guy_Tattoo.Text: Turns the wearer into a bit of a <b>thug</> whilst making sure everybody knows about it.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Mighty_Armlet.Text: Accessorizes the wearer's arm whilst also pushing them to lend an ear to the <b>paragon</> within.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Garter.Text: A little piece of lace is all it takes to let the wearer's <b>vamp</> flourish.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Doh_Hican.Text: Anyone who dons this instantly becomes the biggest <b>clown</> around.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Gold_Rosary.Text: Allows the wearer's <b>daydreamer</> soul to soar high into the clouds.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Leg_Warmers.Text: They don't look like much, but they do a decent job of protecting the wearer's legs.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Ten_Ton_Toupee.Text: A cursed piece of heavy headwear that will have the wearer feeling like a <b>mule</> in no time.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Cower_Ring.Text: A cursed accessory that will have the wearer feeling like a big <b>wimp</> soon enough.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Skull_Ring.Text: Perfect for those who aspire to being a <b>lone wolf</> someday. Run free and look good doing it.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Agility_Ring.Text: Doesn't even fall off during backflips; recommended for an aspiring <b>acrobat</> who might still need some practice.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Mercurys_Bandana.Text: Allows the wearer to move like a <b>bat out of hell</> or something similar. Unclear how an actual bat might wear it.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Meteorite_Bracer.Text: Wristwear that makes the wearer speed around like a shooting star.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Gold_Chain.Text: 24 carat cool that can transform the wearer into a <b>charmer</> quick as you like.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Restless_Heart.Text: The ideal accessory for anyone who wishes to be a <b>plugger</> who won't give up when the going gets tough.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Titan_Belt.Text: Even the most fragile of adventurers will turn into a <b>tough cookie</> after donning this belt.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Recovery_Ring.Text: A magic ring that heals the wearer's wounds while they walk.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Scholars_Specs.Text: Wear these if you need to become a real <b>wit</> nice and quick. Sadly, they don't come with prescription lenses.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Care_Ring.Text: Pop this on to become a really <b>good egg</> who also has a rather nice ring.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Goddess_Ring.Text: A magic ring that restores the wearer's MP while they walk.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Bunny_Tail.Text: Pop this on and hop away to become a <b>happy camper</> in no time at all.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Golden_Tiara.Text: A tiara fit for royalty...but in actuality it only makes the wearer an <b>aristocrat</> with ideas above their station.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Hens_Tooth.Text: Keep this handy and you'll be a <b>lucky devil</> in no time. Sadly, the hen it came from did not enjoy similar good fortune...

Txt_Item_Flavor_Sacred_Amulet.Text: A holy gift from Rubiss to the hero who rescued her.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Elevating_Shoes.Text: Footwear that enhances experience with every single step.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Pacifier.Text: A few sucks on this and the wearer will feel like a <b>spoilt brat</> in no time.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Slime_Earrings.Text: Anyone who wears these oozy earrings will soon feel like a splooper <b>socialite</> with a superb taste in fashion to boot.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Ruby_Wristband.Text: Adorning supersized stones like these will turn the wearer into a <b>show-off</> instantly.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Medical_Herb.Text: Restores at least 30 HP to a single ally. Consumed upon use.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Strong_Medicine.Text: Restores at least 50 HP to a single ally. Consumed upon use.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Special_Medicine.Text: Restores at least 80 HP to a single ally. Consumed upon use.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Sages_Stone.Text: This sacred stone can be used as many times as you like to restore HP to all allies in battle.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Magic_Water.Text: Restores at least 15 MP to a single ally. Consumed upon use.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Sages_Elixir.Text: Restores at least 80 MP to a single ally. Consumed upon use.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Elfin_Elixir.Text: Completely restores a single ally's MP. Consumed upon use.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Prayer_Ring.Text: A pious band that can be used to restore a small amount of MP. However, be warned: it's likely to break if called upon.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Antidotal_Herb.Text: Cures a single ally of poison. Consumed upon use.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Moonwort_Bulb.Text: Cures a single ally of paralysis. Consumed upon use.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Skybell.Text: Cures a single ally of confusion. Consumed upon use.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Dedazzle_Grass.Text: Cures a single ally of their bedazzlement. Consumed upon use.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Whispering_Nectar.Text: Allows allies who've had their spells sealed away to cast freely again. Consumed upon use.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Yggdrasil_Leaf.Text: Returns a single fallen ally to life. Consumed upon use.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Holy_Water.Text: Wards off weaker enemies. Consumed upon use.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Tangleweb.Text: Reduces a group of enemies' agility. Consumed upon use.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Coagulant.Text: Confuses a single enemy. Consumed upon use.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Oomph_Powder.Text: Signifcantly increases a single ally's attack. Consumed upon use.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Chimaera_Wing.Text: Whisks you away to a previously visited location. Consumed upon use.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Dieamend.Text: A rock capable of absorbing an attack that would be fatal, saving its owner's life.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Seed_of_Strength.Text: A nifty nut that permanently increases strength by a little. Consumed upon use.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Seed_Of_Protection.Text: A nifty nut that permanently increases resilience by a little. Consumed upon use.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Seed_Of_Resilience.Text: A nifty nut that permanently increases stamina by a little. Consumed upon use.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Seed_of_Wisdom.Text: A nifty nut that permanently increases wisdom by a little. Consumed upon use.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Seed_of_Agility.Text: A nifty nut that permanently increases agility by a little. Consumed upon use.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Seed_of_Luck.Text: A nifty nut that permanently increases luck by a little. Consumed upon use.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Seed_Of_Life.Text: A nifty nut that permanently increases maximum HP by a little. Consumed upon use.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Seed_Of_Magic.Text: A nifty nut that permanently increases maximum MP by a little. Consumed upon use.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Fail_Is_A_Four_Letter_Wo.Text: A lengthy compendium that details how to become a <b>sore loser</> in no time at all. Feel free to moan if you can't finish it. Consumed upon use.

Txt_Item_Flavor_The_Saddest_Story_Ever_T.Text: A tear-stained book that details how to become a <b>crybaby</> asap. Pick up a box of tissues before reading it. Consumed upon use.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Tears_Before_Bedtime.Text: An in-demand guide that details how to be a <b>spoilt brat</> in a manner most efficient. Read it NOW or else! Consumed upon use.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Loving_Living_A_Grinners.Text: A grass-stained guide that will teach you how to be a <b>happy camper</> or your money back. Best read by an open fire. Consumed upon use.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Comedy_Book.Text: A comical book that teaches you how to <b>clown</> around. Honks sadly when dropped. Consumed upon use.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Diary_of_a_Hardman.Text: A chunky tome that details how to be a <b>meathead</> in words even a child could understand. Consumed upon use.

Txt_Item_Flavor_The_Girls_Own_Annual.Text: A scruffy guide that teaches you how to be a <b>tear-away</> or your money back. Its pages are somewhat perforated. Consumed upon use.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Cheater_Book.Text: An oily compendium that details how to be a <b>slippery devil</> if you can hold on to it for long enough. Consumed upon use.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Benice_Book.Text: A well-loved book that details how to be a <b>good egg</> in the best way possible. Don't shell out more than it's worth. Consumed upon use.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Leap_Before_You_Look.Text: A book that teaches you to be a <b>daredevil</> through learning by doing. Consumed upon use.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Smart_Book.Text: A verbose tome that teaches you to be a <b>genius</> that will go down in history. Make sure you don your thinking cap before reading it. Consumed upon use.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Primms_Primer.Text: An ornate tome that teaches you to be an <b>aristocrat</> of the highest calibre. Best read out loud with proper posture and enunciation. Consumed upon use.

Txt_Item_Flavor_The_Champions_Code.Text: A shining tome that teaches you how to be a <b>paragon</> personified. Go forth and be the best version of you there is. Consumed upon use.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Naughty_Book.Text: An interesting magazine that teaches you all about brawn and bunnies. You'll make a fine <b>vamp</> or <b>charmer</> after perusing its pages. Consumed upon use.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Sphere_Of_Light.Text: A gift from the Dragon Queen, this blessed jewel can banish even the most malignant forces.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Fading_Jenny.Text: This peculiar herb causes anyone who applies it to their skin to turn invisible for a short while. Consumed upon use.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Lyre_Of_Ire.Text: The not-so-dulcet tones of this stringed instrument can cause monsters to appear out of nowhere!

Txt_Item_Flavor_Pouch_Of_Musk.Text: A special scent used to lure monsters. It's certainly a memorable fragrance. Consumed upon use.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Night_Light.Text: This all-too-odd lamp can turn day to night at a moment's notice when used on the world map.

Txt_Item_Flavor_War_Drum.Text: A rousing instrument that can raise the attack of all allies.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Words_Of_Wisdom.Text: A scroll that reveals the innermost secrets of life. Once used to change the reader's vocation, it will fade into the ether.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Adventurers_Map.Text: A handy map that features the whole wide world.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Faerie_Map.Text: An excellent aid for anyone who needs to get around Alefgard.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Wrecking_Ball.Text: This magical explosive came from the mind of one of Reeve's more mature residents after years of scrupulous research.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Dreamstone.Text: The faeries' most-prized treasure; stare at it for too long and you might just nod off.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Wakey_Dust.Text: Magical powder that's perfect for waking those unable to open their eyes. A gift from the queen of the faeries.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Royal_Missive.Text: Penned by the king of Portoga and addressed to Nordy the dwarf, who is often found in the grotto bearing his name.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Black_Pepper.Text: This eastern spice is highly sought after by the king of Portoga, and mostly easily acquired in Baharata.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Ras_Mirror.Text: A prized piece of glass that shows a person's true self.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Mod_Rod.Text: This mysterious staff allows the wielder to transform themselves into almost anything they like.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Boatmans_Bone.Text: The holder of these cursed remains is said to sometimes spy a ghost ship whilst sailing the high seas.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Lovers_Locket.Text: This pendant, found on the ghost ship, is imbued with the ardure and affection of two star-crossed lovers.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Bottomless_Pot.Text: This vessel could drain the world's oceans and still have room for more.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Thiefs_Key.Text: Master thief Kirk Buzzer's finest creation. Opens all the world's red doors.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Magic_Key.Text: Found inside an ancient pyramid, this dusty key opens all the world's blue doors.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Ultimate_Key.Text: Found inside the Shallows Shrine, this key is capable of opening any door in the entire world.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Echo_Flute.Text: This flute creates an echo if played near one of the orbs of legend.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Red_Orb.Text: An enchanting sphere that's the hue of vermillion.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Green_Orb.Text: An entrancing sphere that's the hue of emerald.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Purple_Orb.Text: An awe-inspiring sphere that's the hue of violet.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Blue_Orb.Text: A magnificent sphere that's the hue of azure.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Silver_Orb.Text: A majestic sphere that's the hue of silver.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Yellow_Orb.Text: A glorious sphere that's the hue of citrine.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Faerie_Flute.Text: Filled with mighty faerie magic, this flute can be used in battle to send a group of enemies off to beddy-byes.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Sunstone.Text: This sacred stone is the stuff of legend in Alefgard. Cures all party members of the effects of sleep when used in battle.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Rainbow_Drop.Text: Created by combining the Sunstone and the Staff of Rain just as Rubiss recommended.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Orichalcum.Text: A rare ore of unparalleled durability; it was long thought to be little more than a legend.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Very_Naughty_Book.Text: An extra-interesting magazine that teaches you the ways of the sage. Remains in your possession even when used to change vocation.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Broken_Sword.Text: Little more than an ornament now, this smashed sword once belonged to an academic in Cantlin who hoped to animate the inanimate.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Hammer_Of_Gaia.Text: Wielded by multiple generations of swordsmiths in Jipang. There's not a weapon out there that wouldn't benefit from a light bashing with this.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Blue_Metal.Text: A bright, shiny ore that boasts a spectacular blue hue. The stuff of dwarven legend.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Golden_Medal.Text: A magnificent medal awarded only to those sufficiently strong enough to defeat the Grand Dragon.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Dragon_Scales.Text: An amulet wrought of a dragon's steely scale.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Amulet_Bell.Text: A curious bell that makes its bearer less likely to be affected by all manner of ailments.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Holy_Symbol_Of_Amulet.Text: A ring that has been blessed to help its wearer avert insta-death.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Fairy_Bangle.Text: A beautiful bangle that boosts the defence of its wearer.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Poison_Resistance_Neckla.Text: An unassuming necklace that helps prevent its wearer from succumbing to poison.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Sealing_Resistance_Neckl.Text: A magical necklace that helps prevent its wearer from having their spells sealed away.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Phantom_Resistance_Neckl.Text: An intriguing necklace that helps prevent its wearer from becoming bedazzled.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Alarm_Ring.Text: An energising ring that helps prevent its wearer from being sent to sleep.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Mangetsu_Ring.Text: A perfectly pure ring that helps prevent its wearer from succumbing to paralysis.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Ring_Of_Reason.Text: A spellbound ring that helps prevent its wearer from capitulating to confusion.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Flame_Earrings.Text: Enchanted earrings that reduce damage dealt by fire attacks and spells.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Ice_Earrings.Text: Enchanted earrings that reduce damage dealt by ice attacks and spells.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Wind_Earrings.Text: Enchanted earrings that reduce damage dealt by wind attacks and spells.

Txt_Item_Flavor_Continent_Map.Text: A piece of parchment detailing the topography and landmarks of the Aliahan area.

Txt_Item_Guide_Steel_Broadsword.Text:
Ah, just look at the sheen of that steel. A fine blade indeed.<KEY_WAIT>
You know, I always tell people if they want to be considered skilled with a sword, they first need to master this very weapon.

Txt_Item_Guide_Slapstick.Text:
Oh, this's one of my favourites. You'd think it'd be hard to wield being made of steel and everything, but it handles like a dream!<KEY_WAIT>
At any rate, there's no finer weapon out there if you're itching to slap a monster silly.

Txt_Item_Guide_Orochis_Sword.Text:
Well, I can safely say this is the first blade I've seen that glows green...<KEY_WAIT>
It actually reminds me of a sword featured in Jipang legend... Of course, we all know that stuff's just make-believe, right? Ha ha...

Txt_Item_Guide_Zombiesbane.Text:
You'll struggle to find a holier sword than this one, I'll tell you.<KEY_WAIT>
It also happens to be fairly lightweight too. Even the puniest of priests ought to be able to handle it with few issues.

Txt_Item_Guide_Mountaincleaver.Text:
Oh, Goddess... Pardon me, it's just I've never seen such a sword before.<KEY_WAIT>
I do wonder who once wielded it; they must've been some warrior...

Txt_Item_Guide_Thunderbolt_Blade.Text: I feel like I'm going to get a static shock just looking at this thing...

Txt_Item_Guide_Siren_Sword.Text:
Gosh, it's like I can almost hear it calling out to me...<KEY_WAIT>
No, no, snap out of it! I need to focus right now.

Txt_Item_Guide_Sword_Of_Ruin.Text:
A hateful blade of the highest calibre...<KEY_WAIT>
I've heard all kinds of rumours about this one; none of them good. Be careful around that thing.

Txt_Item_Guide_Sword_Of_Kings.Text:
Now, it's not every day you get to see a sword made of solid orichalcum!<KEY_WAIT>
You'd have to be one heck of a hero to wield something like this, believe you me.<KEY_WAIT>
Either way, if you're skilled enough to have this in your arsenal, you've got nothing to fear.

Txt_Item_Guide_Falcon_Blade.Text:
A lovely lean little number, eh?<KEY_WAIT>
Makes the wielder feel light as a feather in battle, so they say!

Txt_Item_Guide_Stormlords_Sword.Text:
Now, this one's made from a rather peculiar metal. The name's not for show either; it really is imbued with thunderous energy.<KEY_WAIT>
And in case you were wondering, it's that strange shape of the blade's tip that gives it the ability to summon storms at will.

Txt_Item_Guide_Double-Edged_Sword.Text:
Does what it says on the tin really...<KEY_WAIT>
I wouldn't take it into battle myself unless I had no other options.

Txt_Item_Guide_Rubisss_Sword.Text:
Praise the Goddess. To think I'd get to lay eyes on a sword blessed by Rubiss...<KEY_WAIT>
Simply standing near it makes me feel like I too have Her holy blessing.<KEY_WAIT>
Now, go forth and do what needs doing. You've nothing to fear with this in your possession.

Txt_Item_Guide_Golden_Claws.Text:
Ah, I've heard about these. Only martial artists are capable of wielding them.<KEY_WAIT>
Hard to say if it's because they spent so long inside the great pyramid, but they certainly have a peculiar aura.

Txt_Item_Guide_Wizards_Staff.Text:
Anyone serious about learning to use magic is going to wield this staff at one point or another.<KEY_WAIT>
Oh, and that red gem at its tip is what fills it with fiery energy.

Txt_Item_Guide_Somatic_Staff.Text:
Now, this is an odd staff indeed.<KEY_WAIT>
It lets priests and mages use their MP to beef up their physical attacks, so they can keep doing damage even if their spells are sealed away.

Txt_Item_Guide_Lightning_Staff.Text:
Honestly, I don't fancy getting too close to that lest it give me an almighty shock...<KEY_WAIT>
Just be sure you keep it somewhere safe when you're not in a fight, alright?

Txt_Item_Guide_Staff_Of_Rain.Text: Hard to believe, but this staff's supposed to be a genuine rainmaker.

Txt_Item_Guide_Staff_Of_Strife.Text:
A strange little staff indeed.<KEY_WAIT>
Apparently it can deflect spells targeting whoever wields it.

Txt_Item_Guide_Staff_Of_Resurrection.Text: This can return the souls of the dear departed to their bodies...or at least I think that's what someone told me.

Txt_Item_Guide_Aurora_Staff.Text:
What a gorgeous staff...<KEY_WAIT>
...Oh, sorry! I was so busy taking it in I forgot you were here.

Txt_Item_Guide_Astraeas_Abacus.Text:
Ah, now this is a weapon all merchants would love to have.<KEY_WAIT>
Business is sure to boom for anyone lucky enough to get their hands on this!

Txt_Item_Guide_Chain_Sickle.Text:
Now this is a bit of an odd one isn't it?<KEY_WAIT>
I'd always considered sickles harvesting tools myself, but I suppose someone finds a way to weaponise everything sooner or later.

Txt_Item_Guide_Thorn_Whip.Text:
I always recommend this one to any would-be whip wielders!<KEY_WAIT>
I mean, it's got thorns attached to it after all. Any baddy that gets hit with it is going to wish they'd picked a fight with someone else.

Txt_Item_Guide_Gringham_Whip.Text:
This is actually made of three world-class whips that've been combined to make one that's truly top drawer.<KEY_WAIT>
But be warned, each whip moves independently from the rest, so it's not for beginners.<KEY_WAIT>
Honestly, plenty of whip enthusiasts long to get their hands on this one, but very few are capable of mastering it.

Txt_Item_Guide_Destructiball.Text:
A real feast for the eyes, eh?<KEY_WAIT>
Oh and don't be thinking that spiky ball on the end's made from regular old iron; it's some kind of fancy alloy.<KEY_WAIT>
Regardless, I know I wouldn't want to be on the receiving end of a smack with it, that's for sure...

Txt_Item_Guide_Boomerang.Text:
Nothing too special about this one, but it makes a good starter boomerang.<KEY_WAIT>
Either way, any adventurer worth their salt will learn how to wield one of these sooner or later.

Txt_Item_Guide_Edged_Boomerang.Text:
Watch yourself around those blades, alright? Don't want to cut yourself when it comes flying back.<KEY_WAIT>
Obviously, being made of metal makes it a fair bit heftier than your standard wooden boomerang, but it'll serve you well if you master it.<KEY_WAIT>
Certainly does more than enough damage to make learning to wield it worthwhile.

Txt_Item_Guide_Hunters_Moon.Text:
I know it's a bit hard to wrap your head around, but this is basically a boomerang. It just happens to be made from two curved blades bound together.<KEY_WAIT>
Looks a bit like a full moon when it's hurtling through the air. Well, if you squint, at least.

Txt_Item_Guide_Oaken_Club.Text:
Basic as basic gets, but effective if you put those spikes to good use.<KEY_WAIT>
I've certainly sold more than my fair share to first-time adventurers.

Txt_Item_Guide_Sizeable_Scissors.Text:
More suited to mashing monsters than arts and crafts, frankly.<KEY_WAIT>
Oh, and don't bother trying to wield them like a normal weapon; far too big for that. Just attach them to your arm and you're golden.<KEY_WAIT>
And that's the easy part, mind you. Trying to use them in a fight is when the fun really starts.

Txt_Item_Guide_Pot_Lid.Text: Does what it says on the tin<--->er, pot<--->really. Makes an alright shield if you're desperately in need of one.

Txt_Item_Guide_Silver_Platter.Text:
Not really an ideal shield, but it's got handles so you can use it as one if you insist.<KEY_WAIT>
And to be fair, it's actually a lot tougher than it looks. I reckon it could survive a whack or three.

Txt_Item_Guide_Ice_Shield.Text:
An interesting little shield, isn't it? You can tell it was crafted using the toughest ice going.<KEY_WAIT>
That said, I do have my concerns about how it might fare in hotter climes...

Txt_Item_Guide_Tempest_Shield.Text:
Gah, that face'll give you nightmares.<KEY_WAIT>
You know, I sometimes wonder if its protective qualities are thanks to that frightful mug on the front scaring spells off...<KEY_WAIT>
Oh, you didn't think I was being serious, did you?

Txt_Item_Guide_Mirror_Shield.Text:
Oh dear, I hadn't realised how scruffy I looked until I saw myself in this just now.<KEY_WAIT>
But that's neither here nor there; just know you can rely on this shield if you're going up against a foe that wields mighty magic.

Txt_Item_Guide_Heros_Shield.Text:
As the name implies, this special shield can only be wielded by a true hero.<KEY_WAIT>
I do wonder what kinds of valiant adventurers have relied upon it in years gone by...

Txt_Item_Guide_Shield_Of_Shame.Text:
Oh my... Just look at all those eyes.<KEY_WAIT>
Between you and me, I've heard they actually open up at night. Spooky stuff, eh?

Txt_Item_Guide_Goddess_Shield.Text: Praise the Goddess indeed. With such divine protection you shouldn't have too much to worry about.

Txt_Item_Guide_Turban.Text:
Ah, something no good merchant should be seen without.<KEY_WAIT>
What's that? Why do we make a point of wearing them?<KEY_WAIT>
...You know, I've never really thought about it until now...

Txt_Item_Guide_Hardwood_Headwear.Text:
Funny looking thing, isn't it?<KEY_WAIT>
I sometimes see little children making their own and going on pretend adventures with their friends.<KEY_WAIT>
Just warms my heart to see the next generation getting inspired by real adventurers like yourself.

Txt_Item_Guide_Kings_Crown.Text:
Aha, the crown of Romaria! Stunning to take in, though word has it the king himself isn't too keen on it.<KEY_WAIT>
Actually, I remember hearing it was stolen by some dastardly thief a while back.<KEY_WAIT>
You have to wonder if the king was truly all that upset to see it disappear...

Txt_Item_Guide_Hermes_Hat.Text:
You won't find too many hats like this one.<KEY_WAIT>
Oh, and don't be fooled by its light weight; it'll provide you with plenty of protection in a fight.

Txt_Item_Guide_Ortegas_Helm.Text:
Gosh, you can really feel something when you hold this in your hands. This is no ordinary helm.<KEY_WAIT>
Somehow I can just tell it belonged to a warrior who wanted nothing more than to do what was right.

Txt_Item_Guide_Mask_Of_Implacability.Text: Whoa! ...Sorry, I wasn't expecting to see something so scary.

Txt_Item_Guide_Mad_Cap.Text:
Now, this is a fascinating number indeed. The hat itself is imbued with immense magical might.<KEY_WAIT>
Doubtless, any monsters carrying it are sure to have no shortage of hunters after their heads.

Txt_Item_Guide_Phantom_Mask.Text: Supposedly the name comes from the fact that popping it on makes you as light as a ghost.

Txt_Item_Guide_Bunny_Ears.Text:
Absolutely adorable...<KEY_WAIT>
Part of me wants to pop them on and hop around like there's no tomorrow!

Txt_Item_Guide_Hapless_Helm.Text:
Oh dear. I know all about this helm.<KEY_WAIT>
It may look the part, but it's more cursed than you could ever imagine.<KEY_WAIT>
They say its previous owner met an end so unfortunate that no one dares speak of it to this day...

Txt_Item_Guide_Thinking_Cap.Text:
That jewel on the front's said to contain the wisdom of generations of philosophers, you know.<KEY_WAIT>
...But don't expect to become a boffin just by putting it on.

Txt_Item_Guide_Light_Helm.Text:
Would you look at that... Crafted from bona fide zenithium.<KEY_WAIT>
Never thought I'd live to see the real thing in the flesh, frankly.<KEY_WAIT>
Its beauty's matched by its brawn too; this is guaranteed to keep your head from harm no matter the foe.<KEY_WAIT>
Wear it with pride is all I can say...

Txt_Item_Guide_Duplic_Hat.Text: Ah, this hat's highly sought after by spell casters.

Txt_Item_Guide_Leather_Armour.Text:
Nothing special about this armour, but it's nice and cheap, so it never stops selling.<KEY_WAIT>
You might want to upgrade to something stronger once you start encountering tougher foes, though.

Txt_Item_Guide_Tortoise_Shell.Text:
I, uh...<KEY_WAIT>
I mean, sure, it's a solid suit of armour. It's just...<KEY_WAIT>
Is it really worth committing such a fashion faux pas?

Txt_Item_Guide_Boxer_Shorts.Text:
Surprisingly robust for a pair of men's under-garments!<KEY_WAIT>
Some people swear by them, but I don't think I'd be brave enough to go out in public in my pants...

Txt_Item_Guide_Cloak_Of_Evasion.Text:
So light you'd be forgiven for forgetting you were wearing it.<KEY_WAIT>
I'd recommend it for those too slight to don any hefty armour, personally.<KEY_WAIT>
Oh, and in case you're curious, it's an incantation stitched into the back that makes the wearer more agile.

Txt_Item_Guide_Leather_Dress.Text:
Not especially eye-catching, but it still sells well.<KEY_WAIT>
The hide used to make it's also pretty tough, so don't be thinking its only function is fashion.

Txt_Item_Guide_Magical_Skirt.Text: Might look like any old skirt, but it's actually imbued with magic.

Txt_Item_Guide_Silk_Robe.Text:
You won't find a finer silk garment than this, trust me!<KEY_WAIT>
Anyone who pops it on will instantly feel like the fanciest person for miles and miles.

Txt_Item_Guide_Fizzle_Retardant_Suit.Text:
A must-have for anyone who relies on magic.<KEY_WAIT>
Oh, and it comes with a nice little necklace too!

Txt_Item_Guide_Party_Dress.Text:
A darling dress indeed and it's made from some of the finest materials going.<KEY_WAIT>
Just make sure you're refined enough to pull it off lest the dress wear you.

Txt_Item_Guide_Smart_Suit.Text:
Superbly stylish.<KEY_WAIT>
Though, that could end up being a bit of an issue if you're not suave enough to pull it off.<KEY_WAIT>
What? Oh no, I could never get away with wearing something that nice...

Txt_Item_Guide_Earthenwear.Text:
A solid suit of armour that's hard as a rock.<KEY_WAIT>
If memory serves, it was hidden away in Gaia's Navel, right?<KEY_WAIT>
Would be hard to find an earthier location than that...

Txt_Item_Guide_Cat_Suit.Text:
Aww, isn't it just adorable?<KEY_WAIT>
It's more than just a cute costume though! It'll give you ample protection in battle as well.<KEY_WAIT>
And not only that: it's thick enough to keep you nice and toasty should you need to travel through colder climes.

Txt_Item_Guide_Infernal_Armour.Text:
Crafted from the remains of a dastardly demon...or that's what someone once told me anyway.<KEY_WAIT>
And after staring at it for more than a few seconds, I'm honestly inclined to believe them!

Txt_Item_Guide_Scandalous_Swimsuit.Text:
The limited amount of coverage and protection this gives you is scandalous indeed.<KEY_WAIT>
Regardless, it fetches a pretty penny so well done you for saving up to buy it!<KEY_WAIT>
Ahem, anyway, I'm slightly worried it might distract me, so you best take it away...

Txt_Item_Guide_Auroral_Armour.Text:
I must say I adore this shade of blue. It really suits you, {HERO}.<KEY_WAIT>
And as the armour's name would suggest, you yourself are a shining beacon of hope for us all.<KEY_WAIT>
Goddesspeed, {HERO}!

Txt_Item_Guide_Shimmering_Dress.Text:
An elegant little frock, isn't it?<KEY_WAIT>
Seems to shine no matter what angle you look at it from, and it keeps you safe from spells too!

Txt_Item_Guide_Glombolero.Text:
Somewhat on the short side, but it makes up for it with the magical aid it gives the wearer.<KEY_WAIT>
Oh, and don't worry: it might be made of cloth, but it's more than capable of keeping you from harm.

Txt_Item_Guide_Yggdrasil_Dress_Coat.Text:
The sort of thing a kindly king of old might have once worn...<KEY_WAIT>
As it happens, the special material it's made from ought to keep you safe from some annoying enemy attacks too.

Txt_Item_Guide_Exotoga.Text:
Gosh, I could stare at this for hours on end. Simply stunning...<KEY_WAIT>
I hear it's extra effective at protecting whoever wears it from all kinds of nasty spells too.

Txt_Item_Guide_Magic_Water.Text: Handy to have if you need to restore a few MP.

Txt_Item_Guide_Prayer_Ring.Text: Pop this on your finger and you'll be able to restore some lost MP.

Txt_Item_Guide_Antidotal_Herb.Text: You'll want one of these handy if you need to cure someone who's been poisoned.

Txt_Item_Guide_Moonwort_Bulb.Text: Look no further than this if you have to help someone who's been paralysed.

Txt_Item_Guide_Skybell.Text: Great for sorting out anyone who's feeling a bit confused.

Txt_Item_Guide_Dedazzle_Grass.Text:
Can cure anyone from the effects of spells like Dazzle.<KEY_WAIT>
Supposedly, it's how bitter it tastes that snaps people out of their bedazzlement.

Txt_Item_Guide_Whispering_Nectar.Text:
Handy if you've been unlucky enough to have your spells sealed away.<KEY_WAIT>
Which happens most often when someone casts Fizzle on you.<KEY_WAIT>
And it's fairly sweet to boot! Almost makes you want to go out and get into bother just to have an excuse to indulge in some...

Txt_Item_Guide_Yggdrasil_Leaf.Text:
This can revive anyone unfortunate enough to find themselves perished.<KEY_WAIT>
Surprisingly rare for something that should grow on trees too... I honestly have no idea where you get them.

Txt_Item_Guide_Holy_Water.Text: Use this if you want to keep weaker monsters away from you for a wee while.

Txt_Item_Guide_Coagulant.Text:
This can confuse ene<---> Hang on, where am I? Oh, right, so as I was saying...<KEY_WAIT>
Wait, what was I... No, snap out of it!<KEY_WAIT>
Sorry about that. Nearly confused myself. This can be used to confuse enemies, but it's particularly potent so watch yourself around it.

Txt_Item_Guide_Chimaera_Wing.Text:
This handy little thing lets you visit almost anywhere you've been before. Just picture the place in your mind and chuck the wing up into the air!<KEY_WAIT>
I do feel a bit sorry for the chimaeras, though...

Txt_Item_Guide_Seed_Of_Strength.Text: Use this to give your strength a nice boost.

Txt_Item_Guide_Seed_Of_Protection.Text: Use this to give your resilience a nice boost.

Txt_Item_Guide_Seed_Of_Resilience.Text: Use this to give your stamina a nice boost.

Txt_Item_Guide_Seed_Of_Wisdom.Text: Use this to give your wisdom a nice boost.

Txt_Item_Guide_Seed_Of_Agility.Text: Use this to give your agility a nice boost.

Txt_Item_Guide_Seed_Of_Luck.Text: Use this to give your luck a nice boost.

Txt_Item_Guide_Seed_Of_Life.Text: Use this to give your maximum HP a nice boost.

Txt_Item_Guide_Seed_Of_Magic.Text: Use this to give your maximum MP a nice boost.

Txt_Item_Guide_Naughty_Book.Text: Oh my, this's my favo<---> I mean, I haven't the faintest idea what this could be!

Txt_Item_Guide_Sphere_Of_Light.Text:
I've never seen something so divine in all my life...<KEY_WAIT>
This is exactly what you need to banish the darkness and quench the realm's thirst for light!<KEY_WAIT>
Whatever you do, don't stop now. You're so close!

Txt_Item_Guide_Fading_Jenny.Text:
This lets you turn completely invisible!<KEY_WAIT>
Could come in extra handy should you need to get in somewhere you normally couldn't.<KEY_WAIT>
Just imagine you bumped into someone determined not to let you pass; well, they could hardly stop you if they didn't know you were there, could they?

Txt_Item_Guide_Lyre_Of_Ire.Text:
This once belonged to a wandering minstrel by the name of Galen.<KEY_WAIT>
And you don't need to be a musician to admire the skills of its craftsman.<KEY_WAIT>
Oh, but be warned: it's not just humans that enjoy listening to its tones; monsters will come from far and wide to hear this instrument echo, so no careless strumming, alright?

Txt_Item_Guide_Words_Of_Wisdom.Text:
Ah, you'll need this if you fancy becoming a sage.<KEY_WAIT>
Would love to give it a read myself, but it'd probably just go over my head...

Txt_Item_Guide_Adventurers_Map.Text: Got somewhere you need to go? Then this map ought to come in handy.

Txt_Item_Guide_Faerie_Map.Text: Got somewhere to go in Alefgard? Then this map ought to come in handy.

Txt_Item_Guide_Royal_Missive.Text: A lovely letter addressed to Nordy the dwarf by the king of Portoga himself.

Txt_Item_Guide_Ras_Mirror.Text:
Now this looks rather fancy.<KEY_WAIT>
Oh look, there's my face! Hello, me!

Txt_Item_Guide_Very_Naughty_Book.Text:
My days... To think it truly existed...<KEY_WAIT>
And what's more that I, but a humble merchant, would get to appraise it.<KEY_WAIT>
Even the Goddess Herself probably has no clue what lies within these pages...

Txt_Item_Guide_Broken_Sword.Text:
Well, this wouldn't be much use in a fight, would it? Looks ancient to boot...<KEY_WAIT>
You know, I don't think I've ever seen one quite like it, though. Either someone made it with traditonal techniques, or it really is as old as it appears.<KEY_WAIT>
It's not dulled at all either. It must've been some sword back in its day!

Txt_Item_Guide_Hammer_Of_Gaia.Text:
Wow, let me have a look at tha<---><KEY_WAIT>
Whoa, sorry. Wasn't expecting it to be quite so heavy. Nearly dropped the blasted thing on my foot.<KEY_WAIT>
No doubt you could make some seriously strong gear with this to hand.

Txt_Item_Guide_BLUE_METAL.Text:
Such a beautiful shade of blue...<KEY_WAIT>
You know, I've been a merchant for many years now, but this is my first time seeing an ore of this ilk.

Txt_Item_Guide_Continent_Map.Text: Got somewhere to go in Aliahan? Then this map ought to come in handy.

Txt_Item_Guide_COMMON1.Text: <Cap><IndefSgl_I_NAME>, eh? Ahh yes, <IfPlrNoun_I_NAME(formidable weapons these,quite a weapon)>.

Txt_Item_Guide_COMMON2.Text: <Cap><IndefSgl_I_NAME>, eh? Ahh yes, a shield and a half...

Txt_Item_Guide_COMMON3.Text: <Cap><IndefSgl_I_NAME>, eh? Ahh yes, <IfPlrNoun_I_NAME(headgear worth wearing,a remarkable piece of headgear)>...

Txt_Item_Guide_COMMON4.Text: <Cap><IndefSgl_I_NAME>, eh? Ahh yes, head-turning attire, and no mistake...

Txt_Item_Guide_COMMON5.Text: Oh, I've seen <IfPlrNoun_I_NAME(these,this)> before! It's <IndefSgl_I_NAME>, right? Yeah, <IfPlrNoun_I_NAME(great little accessories,a great little accessory)>, <IfPlrNoun_I_NAME(these,this)>...

Txt_Item_Guide_COMMON6.Text: Oh my. You've got yourself some very special gear there!

Txt_Item_Guide_COMMON8.Text: This is that stuff you can use to restore your health when you're flagging, eh?

Txt_Item_Guide_COMMON10.Text: <Cap><IndefSgl_I_NAME>, eh? Ahh yes, <IfPlrNoun_I_NAME(very interesting items these,a very interesting item this)>...

Txt_Item_Guide_Steel_Broadsword_F.Text:
Ah, just look at the sheen of that steel. A fine blade indeed.<KEY_WAIT>
You know, I always tell people if they want to be considered skilled with a sword, they first need to master this very weapon.

Txt_Item_Guide_Slapstick_F.Text:
Oh, this's one of my favourites. You'd think it'd be hard to wield being made of steel and everything, but it handles like a dream!<KEY_WAIT>
At any rate, there's no finer weapon out there if you're itching to slap a monster silly.

Txt_Item_Guide_Orochis_Sword_F.Text:
Well, I can safely say this is the first blade I've seen that glows green...<KEY_WAIT>
It actually reminds me of a sword featured in Jipang legend... Of course, we all know that stuff's just make-believe, right? Ha ha...

Txt_Item_Guide_Zombiesbane_F.Text:
You'll struggle to find a holier sword than this one, I'll tell you.<KEY_WAIT>
It also happens to be fairly lightweight too. Even the puniest of priests ought to be able to handle it with few issues.

Txt_Item_Guide_Mountaincleaver_F.Text:
Oh, Goddess... Pardon me, it's just I've never seen such a sword before.<KEY_WAIT>
I do wonder who once wielded it; they must've been some warrior...

Txt_Item_Guide_Thunderbolt_Blade_F.Text: I feel like I'm going to get a static shock just looking at this thing...

Txt_Item_Guide_Siren_Sword_F.Text:
Gosh, it's like I can almost hear it calling out to me...<KEY_WAIT>
No, no, snap out of it! I need to focus right now.

Txt_Item_Guide_Sword_Of_Ruin_F.Text:
A hateful blade of the highest calibre...<KEY_WAIT>
I've heard all kinds of rumours about this one; none of them good. Be careful around that thing.

Txt_Item_Guide_Sword_Of_Kings_F.Text:
Now, it's not every day you get to see a sword made of solid orichalcum!<KEY_WAIT>
You'd have to be one heck of a hero to wield something like this, believe you me.<KEY_WAIT>
Either way, if you're skilled enough to have that in your arsenal, you've got nothing to fear.

Txt_Item_Guide_Falcon_Blade_F.Text:
A lovely lean little number, eh?<KEY_WAIT>
Makes the wielder feel light as a feather in battle, so they say!

Txt_Item_Guide_Stormlords_Sword_F.Text:
Now, this one's made from a rather peculiar metal. The name's not for show either; it really is imbued with thunderous energy.<KEY_WAIT>
And in case you were wondering, it's that strange shape of the blade's tip that gives it the ability to summon storms at will.

Txt_Item_Guide_Double-Edged_Sword_F.Text:
Does what it says on the tin really...<KEY_WAIT>
I wouldn't take it into battle myself unless I had no other options.

Txt_Item_Guide_Rubisss_Sword_F.Text:
Praise the Goddess. To think I'd get to lay eyes on a sword blessed by Rubiss...<KEY_WAIT>
Simply standing near it makes me feel like I too have Her holy blessing.<KEY_WAIT>
Now, go forth and do what needs doing. You've nothing to fear with this in your possession.

Txt_Item_Guide_Golden_Claws_F.Text:
Ah, I've heard about these. Only martial artists are capable of wielding them.<KEY_WAIT>
Hard to say if it's because they spent so long inside the great pyramid, but they certainly have a peculiar aura.

Txt_Item_Guide_Wizards_Staff_F.Text:
Anyone serious about learning to use magic is going to wield this staff at one point or another.<KEY_WAIT>
Oh, and that red gem at its tip is what fills it with fiery energy.

Txt_Item_Guide_Somatic_Staff_F.Text:
Now, this is an odd staff indeed.<KEY_WAIT>
It lets priests and mages use their MP to beef up their physical attacks, so they can keep doing damage even if their spells are sealed away.

Txt_Item_Guide_Lightning_Staff_F.Text:
Honestly, I don't fancy getting too close to that lest it give me an almighty shock...<KEY_WAIT>
Just be sure you keep that somewhere safe when you're not in a fight, alright?

Txt_Item_Guide_Staff_Of_Rain_F.Text: Hard to believe, but this staff's supposed to be a genuine rainmaker.

Txt_Item_Guide_Staff_Of_Strife_F.Text:
A strange little staff indeed.<KEY_WAIT>
Apparently it can deflect spells targeting whoever wields it.

Txt_Item_Guide_Staff_Of_Resurrection_F.Text: This can return the souls of the dear departed to their bodies...or at least I think that's what someone told me.

Txt_Item_Guide_Aurora_Staff_F.Text:
What a gorgeous staff...<KEY_WAIT>
...Oh, sorry! I was so busy taking it in I forgot you were here.

Txt_Item_Guide_Astraeas_Abacus_F.Text:
Ah, now this is a weapon all merchants would love to have.<KEY_WAIT>
Business is sure to boom for anyone lucky enough to get their hands on this!

Txt_Item_Guide_Chain_Sickle_F.Text:
Now this is a bit of an odd one isn't it?<KEY_WAIT>
I'd always considered sickles harvesting tools myself, but I suppose someone finds a way to weaponise everything sooner or later.

Txt_Item_Guide_Thorn_Whip_F.Text:
I always recommend this one to any would-be whip wielders!<KEY_WAIT>
I mean, it's got thorns attached to it after all. Any baddy that gets hit with it is going to wish they'd picked a fight with someone else.

Txt_Item_Guide_Gringham_Whip_F.Text:
This is actually made of three world-class whips that've been combined to make one that's truly top drawer.<KEY_WAIT>
But be warned, each whip moves independently from the rest, so it's not for beginners.<KEY_WAIT>
Honestly, plenty of whip enthusiasts long to get their hands on this one, but very few are capable of mastering it.

Txt_Item_Guide_Destructiball_F.Text:
A real feast for the eyes, eh?<KEY_WAIT>
Oh and don't be thinking that spiky ball on the end's made from regular old iron; it's some kind of fancy alloy.<KEY_WAIT>
Regardless, I know I wouldn't want to be on the receiving end of a smack with it, that's for sure...

Txt_Item_Guide_Boomerang_F.Text:
Nothing too special about this one, but it makes a good starter boomerang.<KEY_WAIT>
Either way, any adventurer worth their salt will learn how to wield one of these sooner or later.

Txt_Item_Guide_Edged_Boomerang_F.Text:
Watch yourself around those blades, alright? Don't want to cut yourself when it comes flying back.<KEY_WAIT>
Obviously, being made of metal makes it a fair bit heftier than your standard wooden boomerang, but it'll serve you well if you master it.<KEY_WAIT>
Certainly does more than enough damage to make learning to wield it worthwhile.

Txt_Item_Guide_Hunters_Moon_F.Text:
I know it's a bit hard to wrap your head around, but this is basically a boomerang. It just happens to be made from two curved blades bound together.<KEY_WAIT>
Looks a bit like a full moon when it's hurtling through the air. Well, if you squint, at least.

Txt_Item_Guide_Oaken_Club_F.Text:
Basic as basic gets, but effective if you put those spikes to good use.<KEY_WAIT>
I've certainly sold more than my fair share to first-time adventurers.

Txt_Item_Guide_Sizeable_Scissors_F.Text:
More suited to mashing monsters than arts and crafts, frankly.<KEY_WAIT>
Oh, and don't bother trying to wield them like a normal weapon; far too big for that. Just attach them to your arm and you're golden.<KEY_WAIT>
And that's the easy part, mind you. Trying to use them in a fight is when the fun really starts.

Txt_Item_Guide_Pot_Lid_F.Text: Does what it says on the tin<--->er, pot<--->really. Makes an alright shield if you're desperately in need of one.

Txt_Item_Guide_Silver_Platter_F.Text:
Not really an ideal shield, but it's got handles so you can use it as one if you insist.<KEY_WAIT>
And to be fair, it's actually a lot tougher than it looks. I reckon it could survive a whack or three.

Txt_Item_Guide_Ice_Shield_F.Text:
An interesting little shield, isn't it? You can tell it was crafted using the toughest ice going.<KEY_WAIT>
That said, I do have my concerns about how it might fare in hotter climes...

Txt_Item_Guide_Tempest_Shield_F.Text:
Gah, that face'll give you nightmares.<KEY_WAIT>
You know, I sometimes wonder if its protective qualities are thanks to that frightful mug on the front scaring spells off...<KEY_WAIT>
Oh, you didn't think I was being serious, did you?

Txt_Item_Guide_Mirror_Shield_F.Text:
Oh dear, I hadn't realised how scruffy I looked until I saw myself in this just now.<KEY_WAIT>
But that's neither here nor there; just know you can rely on this shield if you're going up against a foe that wields mighty magic.

Txt_Item_Guide_Heros_Shield_F.Text:
As the name implies, this special shield can only be wielded by a true hero.<KEY_WAIT>
I do wonder what kinds of valiant adventurers have relied upon it in years gone by...

Txt_Item_Guide_Shield_Of_Shame_F.Text:
Oh my... Just look at all those eyes.<KEY_WAIT>
Between you and me, I've heard they actually open up at night. Spooky stuff, eh?

Txt_Item_Guide_Goddess_Shield_F.Text: Praise the Goddess indeed. With such divine protection you shouldn't have too much to worry about.

Txt_Item_Guide_Turban_F.Text:
Ah, something no good merchant should be seen without.<KEY_WAIT>
What's that? Why do we make a point of wearing them?<KEY_WAIT>
...You know, I've never really thought about it until now... But more and more of us are sporting different looks nowadays!

Txt_Item_Guide_Hardwood_Headwear_F.Text:
Funny looking thing, isn't it?<KEY_WAIT>
I sometimes see little children making their own and going on pretend adventures with their friends.<KEY_WAIT>
Just warms my heart to see the next generation getting inspired by real adventurers like yourself.

Txt_Item_Guide_Kings_Crown_F.Text:
Aha, the crown of Romaria! Stunning to take in, though word has it the king himself isn't too keen on it.<KEY_WAIT>
Actually, I remember hearing it was stolen by some dastardly thief a while back.<KEY_WAIT>
You have to wonder if the king was truly all that upset to see it disappear...

Txt_Item_Guide_Hermes_Hat_F.Text:
You won't find too many hats like this one.<KEY_WAIT>
Oh, and don't be fooled by its light weight; it'll provide you with plenty of protection in a fight.

Txt_Item_Guide_Ortegas_Helm_F.Text:
Gosh, just look at this. Whoever it belonged to clearly experienced their fair share of fights.<KEY_WAIT>
Somehow I can just tell it belonged to a kind soul who wanted nothing more than to do what was right.

Txt_Item_Guide_Mask_Of_Implacability_F.Text: Whoa! ...Sorry, I wasn't expecting to see something so scary.

Txt_Item_Guide_Mad_Cap_F.Text:
Now, this is a fascinating number indeed. The hat itself is imbued with immense magical might.<KEY_WAIT>
Doubtless, any monsters carrying it are sure to have no shortage of hunters after their heads.

Txt_Item_Guide_Phantom_Mask_F.Text: Supposedly the name comes from the fact that popping it on makes you as light as a ghost.

Txt_Item_Guide_Bunny_Ears_F.Text:
Absolutely adorable...<KEY_WAIT>
Part of me wants to pop them on and hop around like there's no tomorrow!<KEY_WAIT>
Just a shame they don't provide much protection in battle...

Txt_Item_Guide_Hapless_Helm_F.Text:
Oh dear. I know all about this helm.<KEY_WAIT>
It may look the part, but it's more cursed than you could ever imagine.<KEY_WAIT>
They say its previous owner met an end so unfortunate that no one dares speak of it to this day...

Txt_Item_Guide_Thinking_Cap_F.Text:
That jewel on the front's said to contain the wisdom of generations of philosophers, you know.<KEY_WAIT>
...But don't expect to become a boffin just by putting it on.

Txt_Item_Guide_Light_Helm_F.Text:
Would you look at that... Crafted from bona fide zenithium.<KEY_WAIT>
Never thought I'd live to see the real thing in the flesh, frankly.<KEY_WAIT>
Its beauty's matched by its brawn too; this is guaranteed to keep your head from harm no matter the foe.<KEY_WAIT>
Wear it with pride is all I can say...

Txt_Item_Guide_Duplic_Hat_F.Text: Ah, this hat's highly sought after by spell casters.

Txt_Item_Guide_Leather_Armour_F.Text:
Nothing special about this armour, but it's nice and cheap, so it never stops selling.<KEY_WAIT>
You might want to upgrade to something stronger once you start encountering tougher foes, though.

Txt_Item_Guide_Tortoise_Shell_F.Text:
I, uh...<KEY_WAIT>
I mean, sure, it's a solid suit of armour. It's just...<KEY_WAIT>
Is it really worth committing such a fashion faux pas?

Txt_Item_Guide_Boxer_Shorts_F.Text:
Surprisingly robust for a pair of men's under-garments!<KEY_WAIT>
Some people swear by them, but I'd definitely keep my distance from anyone walking around in their pants...

Txt_Item_Guide_Cloak_Of_Evasion_F.Text:
So light you'd be forgiven for forgetting you were wearing it.<KEY_WAIT>
I'd recommend it for those too slight to don any hefty armour, personally.<KEY_WAIT>
Oh, and in case you're curious, it's an incantation stitched into the back that makes the wearer more agile.

Txt_Item_Guide_Leather_Dress_F.Text:
Not especially eye-catching, but it still sells well.<KEY_WAIT>
The hide used to make it's also pretty tough, so don't be thinking its only function is fashion.

Txt_Item_Guide_Magical_Skirt_F.Text: Might look like any old skirt, but it's actually imbued with magic.

Txt_Item_Guide_Silk_Robe_F.Text:
You won't find a finer silk garment than this, trust me!<KEY_WAIT>
Anyone who pops it on will instantly feel like the fanciest person for miles and miles.

Txt_Item_Guide_Fizzle_Retardant_Suit_F.Text:
A must-have for anyone who relies on magic.<KEY_WAIT>
Oh, and it comes with a nice little necklace too!

Txt_Item_Guide_Party_Dress_F.Text:
A darling dress indeed and it's made from some of the finest materials going.<KEY_WAIT>
I'd love to wear it myself one day, but I'm far too busy to attend any parties...

Txt_Item_Guide_Smart_Suit_F.Text:
Superbly stylish.<KEY_WAIT>
Though, that could end up being a bit of an issue if you're not suave enough to pull it off.<KEY_WAIT>
Honestly, wearing something so fancy must feel amazing if you can get away with it.

Txt_Item_Guide_Earthenwear_F.Text:
A solid suit of armour that's hard as a rock.<KEY_WAIT>
If memory serves, it was hidden away in Gaia's Navel, right?<KEY_WAIT>
Would be hard to find an earthier location than that...

Txt_Item_Guide_Cat_Suit_F.Text:
Aww, isn't it just adorable?<KEY_WAIT>
It's more than just a cute costume though! It'll give you ample protection in battle as well.<KEY_WAIT>
And not only that: it's thick enough to keep you nice and toasty should you need to travel through colder climes.

Txt_Item_Guide_Infernal_Armour_F.Text:
Crafted from the remains of a dastardly demon...or that's what someone once told me anyway.<KEY_WAIT>
And after staring at it for more than a few seconds, I'm honestly inclined to believe them!

Txt_Item_Guide_Scandalous_Swimsuit_F.Text:
The limited amount of coverage and protection this gives you is scandalous indeed.<KEY_WAIT>
At least, I know I wouldn't want to head into battle in it.<KEY_WAIT>
But that would be quite the sight, wouldn't it?

Txt_Item_Guide_Auroral_Armour_F.Text:
I must say I adore this shade of blue. It really suits you, {HERO}.<KEY_WAIT>
And as the armour's name would suggest, you yourself are a shining beacon of hope for us all.<KEY_WAIT>
Goddesspeed, {HERO}!

Txt_Item_Guide_Shimmering_Dress_F.Text:
An elegant little frock, isn't it?<KEY_WAIT>
Seems to shine no matter what angle you look at it from, and it keeps you safe from spells too!

Txt_Item_Guide_Glombolero_F.Text:
Somewhat on the short side, but it makes up for it with the magical aid it gives the wearer.<KEY_WAIT>
Oh, and don't worry: it might be made of cloth, but it's more than capable of keeping you from harm.

Txt_Item_Guide_Yggdrasil_Dress_Coat_F.Text:
The sort of thing a kindly king of old might have once worn...<KEY_WAIT>
As it happens, the special material it's made from ought to keep you safe from some annoying enemy attacks too.

Txt_Item_Guide_Exotoga_F.Text:
Gosh, I could stare at that for hours on end. Simply stunning...<KEY_WAIT>
I hear it's extra effective at protecting whoever wears it from all kinds of nasty spells too.

Txt_Item_Guide_Magic_Water_F.Text: Handy to have if you need to restore a few MP.

Txt_Item_Guide_Prayer_Ring_F.Text: Pop this on your finger and you'll be able to restore some lost MP.

Txt_Item_Guide_Antidotal_Herb_F.Text: You'll want one of these handy if you need to cure someone who's been poisoned.

Txt_Item_Guide_Moonwort_Bulb_F.Text: Look no further than this if you have to help someone who's been paralysed.

Txt_Item_Guide_Skybell_F.Text: Great for sorting out anyone who's feeling a bit confused.

Txt_Item_Guide_Dedazzle_Grass_F.Text:
Can cure anyone from the effects of spells like Dazzle.<KEY_WAIT>
Supposedly, it's how bitter it tastes that snaps people out of their bedazzlement.

Txt_Item_Guide_Whispering_Nectar_F.Text:
Handy if you've been unlucky enough to have your spells sealed away.<KEY_WAIT>
Which happens most often when someone casts Fizzle on you.<KEY_WAIT>
And it's fairly sweet to boot! Almost makes you want to go out and get into bother just to have an excuse to indulge in some...

Txt_Item_Guide_Yggdrasil_Leaf_F.Text:
This can revive anyone unfortunate enough to find themselves perished.<KEY_WAIT>
Surprisingly rare for something that should grow on trees too... I honestly have no idea where you get them.

Txt_Item_Guide_Holy_Water_F.Text: Use this if you want to keep weaker monsters away from you for a wee while.

Txt_Item_Guide_Coagulant_F.Text:
This can confuse ene<---> Hang on, where am I? Oh, right, so as I was saying...<KEY_WAIT>
Wait, what was I... No, snap out of it!<KEY_WAIT>
Sorry about that. Nearly confused myself. This can be used to confuse enemies, but it's particularly potent so watch yourself around it.

Txt_Item_Guide_Chimaera_Wing_F.Text:
This handy little thing lets you visit almost anywhere you've been before. Just picture the place in your mind and chuck the wing up into the air!<KEY_WAIT>
I do feel a bit sorry for the chimaeras, though...

Txt_Item_Guide_Seed_Of_Strength_F.Text: Use this to give your strength a nice boost.

Txt_Item_Guide_Seed_Of_Protection_F.Text: Use this to give your resilience a nice boost.

Txt_Item_Guide_Seed_Of_Resilience_F.Text: Use this to give your stamina a nice boost.

Txt_Item_Guide_Seed_Of_Wisdom_F.Text: Use this to give your wisdom a nice boost.

Txt_Item_Guide_Seed_Of_Agility_F.Text: Use this to give your agility a nice boost.

Txt_Item_Guide_Seed_Of_Luck_F.Text: Use this to give your luck a nice boost.

Txt_Item_Guide_Seed_Of_Life_F.Text: Use this to give your maximum HP a nice boost.

Txt_Item_Guide_Seed_Of_Magic_F.Text: Use this to give your maximum MP a nice boost.

Txt_Item_Guide_Naughty_Book_F.Text: Oh, Goddess! Please, do not brandish such filth around me!

Txt_Item_Guide_Sphere_Of_Light_F.Text:
I've never seen something so divine in all my life...<KEY_WAIT>
This is exactly what you need to banish the darkness and quench the realm's thirst for light!<KEY_WAIT>
Whatever you do, don't stop now. You're so close!

Txt_Item_Guide_Fading_Jenny_F.Text:
This lets you turn completely invisible!<KEY_WAIT>
Could come in extra handy should you need to get in somewhere you normally couldn't.<KEY_WAIT>
Just imagine you bumped into someone determined not to let you pass; well, they could hardly stop you if they didn't know you were there, could they?

Txt_Item_Guide_Lyre_Of_Ire_F.Text:
This once belonged to a wandering minstrel by the name of Galen.<KEY_WAIT>
And you don't need to be a musician to admire the skills of its craftsman.<KEY_WAIT>
Oh, but be warned: it's not just humans that enjoy listening to its tones; monsters will come from far and wide to hear this instrument echo, so no careless strumming, alright?

Txt_Item_Guide_Words_Of_Wisdom_F.Text:
Ah, you'll need this if you fancy becoming a sage.<KEY_WAIT>
Would love to give it a read myself, but it'd probably just go over my head...

Txt_Item_Guide_Adventurers_Map_F.Text: Got somewhere you need to go? Then this map ought to come in handy.

Txt_Item_Guide_Faerie_Map_F.Text: Got somewhere to go in Alefgard? Then this map ought to come in handy.

Txt_Item_Guide_Royal_Missive_F.Text: A lovely letter addressed to Nordy the dwarf by the king of Portoga himself.

Txt_Item_Guide_Ras_Mirror_F.Text:
Now this looks rather fancy.<KEY_WAIT>
Oh look, there's my face! Hello, me!

Txt_Item_Guide_Very_Naughty_Book_F.Text:
My days... To think it truly existed...<KEY_WAIT>
And what's more that I would be made to appraise it.<KEY_WAIT>
Even the Goddess Herself probably has no clue what lies within these pages... Be sure you're well prepared before you dare look within.

Txt_Item_Guide_Broken_Sword_F.Text:
Well, this wouldn't be much use in a fight, would it? Looks ancient to boot...<KEY_WAIT>
You know, I don't think I've ever seen one quite like it, though. Either someone made it with traditonal techniques, or it really is as old as it appears.<KEY_WAIT>
It's not dulled at all either. It must've been some sword back in its day!

Txt_Item_Guide_Hammer_Of_Gaia_F.Text:
Wow, let me have a look at tha<---><KEY_WAIT>
Whoa, sorry. Wasn't expecting it to be quite so heavy. Nearly dropped the blasted thing on my foot.<KEY_WAIT>
No doubt you could make some seriously strong gear with this to hand.

Txt_Item_Guide_BLUE_METAL_F.Text:
Such a beautiful shade of blue...<KEY_WAIT>
You know, I've been a merchant for many years now, but this is my first time seeing an ore of this ilk.

Txt_Item_Guide_Continent_Map_F.Text: Got somewhere to go in Aliahan? Then this map ought to come in handy.

Txt_Item_Guide_COMMON1_F.Text: <Cap><IndefSgl_I_NAME>, eh? Ahh yes, <IfPlrNoun_I_NAME(formidable weapons these,quite a weapon)>.

Txt_Item_Guide_COMMON2_F.Text: <Cap><IndefSgl_I_NAME>, eh? Ahh yes, a shield and a half...

Txt_Item_Guide_COMMON3_F.Text: <Cap><IndefSgl_I_NAME>, eh? Ahh yes, <IfPlrNoun_I_NAME(headgear worth wearing,a remarkable piece of headgear)>...

Txt_Item_Guide_COMMON4_F.Text: <Cap><IndefSgl_I_NAME>, eh? Ahh yes, head-turning attire, and no mistake...

Txt_Item_Guide_COMMON5_F.Text: Oh, I've seen <IfPlrNoun_I_NAME(these,this)> before! It's <IndefSgl_I_NAME>, right? Yeah, <IfPlrNoun_I_NAME(great little accessories,a great little accessory)>, <IfPlrNoun_I_NAME(these,this)>...

Txt_Item_Guide_COMMON6_F.Text: Oh my. You've got yourself a very special piece of gear there!

Txt_Item_Guide_COMMON8_F.Text: This is that stuff you can use to restore your health when you're flagging, eh?

Txt_Item_Guide_COMMON10_F.Text: <Cap><IndefSgl_I_NAME>, eh? Ahh yes, <IfPlrNoun_I_NAME(very interesting items these,a very interesting item this)>...

Txt_Item_SpecGuideOrochis_Sword.Text: In case you were curious, you can use this as an item in battle to lower the enemy's defence.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideZombiesbane.Text: This weapon'll deal decent damage to undead creatures.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideMountaincleaver.Text:
Hmm, something tells me this sword is more than just a weapon...<KEY_WAIT>
