But staring at it's not going to give us the answers. There must be someone out there who knows more about it, surely.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideDragonsbane.Text: These claws'll deal decent damage to creatures from the dragon family.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideThunderbolt_Blade.Text: You can use this as an item in battle to unleash a great big blast that'll hit all enemies that stand before you.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideSiren_Sword.Text: In case you were curious, you can use this as an item in battle to confuse the enemy.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideSword_Of_Ruin.Text: You can deal plenty of damage with this, but I'm not too sure it's worth all the misfortune that's said to befall the wielder...

Txt_Item_SpecGuideBlizzard_Blade.Text: You can use this as an item in battle to unleash a blustering blizzard on your foes.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideSword_Of_Kings.Text: Ah, you're in for a treat if you use this as an item in battle; it summons two tornadoes that'll rip apart the enemy!

Txt_Item_SpecGuideFalcon_Blade.Text: Lets you unleash two attacks for the price of one! Not a bad deal, eh?

Txt_Item_SpecGuideStormlords_Sword.Text: Go ahead and use this as an item in battle if you fancy making your foes feel nice and toasty.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideDouble-Edged_Sword.Text:
Be sure to think twice before you equip this, alright? Removing it from your person after you wield it once is easier said than done...<KEY_WAIT>
I mean, I do understand the temptation; not many blades cut quite so cleanly, but I'd steer clear of it personally.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideRubisss_Sword.Text: Your enemies are in for an almighty shock if you use this as an item in battle.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideHeadsmans_Axe.Text: Word has it anyone who wields this can unleash critical hits and miss their target completely in almost equal measure.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideConquerors_Axe.Text: Something tells me this gear will pack an almighty punch in a fight.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideSandstorm_Spear.Text: Use this as an item in battle if you want to bedazzle your foes with a sweeping sandstorm.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideDemon_Spear.Text: This can take out an enemy in one hit...if it strikes them in the right place, at least.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideGodly_Poker.Text: A fairly standard weapon that just happens to deal ludicrous amounts of damage.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideGolden_Claws.Text: Oh, do be warned: just having these on you attracts all kinds of baddies down in the depths of the pyramid.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideFire_Claws.Text: Ah, you can use these as an item in battle to bathe an enemy in fire.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideBeast_Claws.Text: These are incredibly effective against beast-family enemies, you know.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideWizards_Staff.Text: You can use this as an item in battle to send fire flying out of the jewel on the staff towards a baddy.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideStaff_Of_Antimagic.Text: Ah, now this is a useful staff to have: you can use it as an item in battle to seal away enemies' spells.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideSomatic_Staff.Text: Anyone wielding this will use up some MP every time they attack, so try to only go on the front foot when it matters.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideStaff_Of_Sentencing.Text: You can use this as an item in battle to let loose the full force of the wind on the enemy.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideLightning_Staff.Text:
Did you know you can use this in a battle to set the very earth on fire?<KEY_WAIT>
What's more, you don't even need to know any magic to use it!<KEY_WAIT>
Pretty nifty, eh?

Txt_Item_SpecGuideSnooze_Stick.Text: Ha, I've always liked this one. You can use it as an item in battle to unleash a sweet aroma that sends enemies off to the land of Nod.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideStaff_Of_Rain.Text:
This'll come in handy as an item in battle if you need to seal away somebody's spells.<KEY_WAIT>
It's funny, its name just made me think of how nice it is when the rain stops, the sun comes out and you're greeted by a big rainbow.<KEY_WAIT>
I wonder what might happen if you had another item connected to the sun... Sorry, just thinking out loud.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideSages_Staff.Text: In case you were wondering, this can be used as an item in battle to heal your allies' wounds.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideStaff_Of_Strife.Text:
Try using this as an item in battle if you want to surround yourself with a spell-deflecting barrier.<KEY_WAIT>
Oh, but do remember: it'll reflect all spells. Even ones cast on you by your allies.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideStaff_Of_Resurrection.Text:
This special little staff can resurrect fallen allies when used as an item in battle.<KEY_WAIT>
Just keep in mind I said <6>can<9>, though. It's not guaranteed to bring people back. I suppose <6>staff of occasional resurrection<9> wouldn't sound as good...

Txt_Item_SpecGuideGodbird_Sceptre.Text:
You can use this staff as an item in battle to summon an enormous ball of fire that'll come crashing down on an enemy.<KEY_WAIT>
And that's not all: when you hit an enemy with it you'll absorb some of their MP!

Txt_Item_SpecGuideAurora_Staff.Text:
Ah, this staff really stands out from the rest. When you use it as an item in battle it not only removes all beneficial effects from enemies, it also neutralises all negative effects affecting allies.<KEY_WAIT>
Monsters are going to think twice before picking a fight as long as you've got this.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideAstraeas_Abacus.Text: Best leave this one to us merchants. We know how to get the best out of it.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideChain_Sickle.Text: Long enough that you'd expect it to hit multiple enemies in one go, but sadly it only damages one per attack.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideThorn_Whip.Text: This'll come in handy if you want to hit multiple enemies with each attack!

Txt_Item_SpecGuideChain_Whip_Items.Text: I suggest wielding this if you want to whack several foes in one go.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideBeastly_Bullwhip.Text: Not only does this whip let you hit multiple enemies in one go, it also deals plenty of pain to enemies from the beast family.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideDragontail_Whip.Text: Not only does this whip let you hit multiple enemies in one go, it also deals plenty of pain to enemies from the dragon family.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideEmpresss_Whip.Text: Not only does this whip let you hit multiple enemies in one go, it also deals plenty of pain to humanoid-family enemies.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideGringham_Whip.Text: This can whack a bunch of baddies in one go just like all the other whips.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideDestructiball.Text: Unsurprisingly, capable of destroying more or less anything in its path.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideBoomerang.Text: This'll hit all the enemies you're facing, but it deals slightly less damage to every foe it hits after the first one.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideEdged_Boomerang.Text: This'll hit all the enemies you're facing, but it deals slightly less damage to every foe it hits after the first one.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideGusterang.Text:
As the name suggests, this brilliant boomerang is imbued with the power of the wind.<KEY_WAIT>
It'll hit all the enemies you're facing, but it deals slightly less damage to every foe it hits after the first one.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideSwallowtail.Text:
This brilliant boomerang deals plenty of pain to foes from the insect family.<KEY_WAIT>
It'll hit all the enemies you're facing, but it deals slightly less damage to every foe it hits after the first one.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideFlametang_Boomerang.Text:
Ah, this one's a fiery little number.<KEY_WAIT>
It'll hit all the enemies you're facing, but it deals slightly less damage to every foe it hits after the first one.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideMetal_Wing_Boomerang.Text:
You'll definitely want this to hand if you're going up against metallic monsters; it's guaranteed to hit any metal-bodied foes, and often lands a critical hit in the process!<KEY_WAIT>
There aren't many better boomerangs out there for my money.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideHunters_Moon.Text:
I know what you're going to say: you don't like boomerangs 'cause you can't pile on the pain if you're up against a load of enemies.<KEY_WAIT>
But what would you say if I told you this one was different? Yes, that's right: it deals the same amount of damage to all foes foolish enough to stand in its path!

Txt_Item_SpecGuidePot_Lid.Text:
I mean, sure, this'll help you defend yourself...kind of.<KEY_WAIT>
But honestly, I'd hurry up and find something better if I were you.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideSilver_Platter.Text: Not only will this protect you, it'll also make you feel fantastically fancy!

Txt_Item_SpecGuideIce_Shield.Text:
Keep <IfPlrNoun_I_NAME(these earrings,this)> handy if you think you might be facing an enemy that can unleash fiery attacks.<KEY_WAIT>
Luckily, it's effective against both spells and breath attacks to boot.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideMagic_Shield.Text: Reduces the damage dealt by any offensive spell an enemy casts on you.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideDragon_Shield.Text: Equip this if you want some extra protection against breath attacks of a fiery or icy nature.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideTempest_Shield.Text: You won't do much better than this if you need to guard yourself against explosive spells.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideFlame_Shield.Text:
<IfPlrNoun_I_NAME(These earrings,This shield)> can bear the brunt of ice attacks so they do less damage to the wielder.<KEY_WAIT>
Thankfully, that applies to both spells and breath attacks alike.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideMirror_Shield.Text:
Ah, yes, this can reflect spells the same way it reflects your face back at you if you stand in front of it.<KEY_WAIT>
Though, remember: it reflects all spells, regardless of who cast them.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideOgre_Shield.Text: This shield doesn't have any fancy powers or anything, but few bucklers out there will provide you with this level of protection.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideShield_Of_Shame.Text:
Sure, this'll protect you from attacks. It's just, well...<KEY_WAIT>
The damage you would've taken from the blow will get dumped on one of your friends instead.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideGoddess_Shield.Text: This divine shield lessens the damage dealt by enemy spells and breath attacks of a fiery or icy nature.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideTurban.Text: Honestly, there's nothing inherently special about this turban, but don't you just feel ready to make your fortune the second you pop it on?

Txt_Item_SpecGuideHardwood_Headwear.Text: Far from the fanciest of headgear, but beginner adventurers swear by it.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideKings_Crown.Text: You know, I'm starting to realise why Robbin' 'Ood was so keen on pinching this. It must be made of pure gold...

Txt_Item_SpecGuideScholars_Cap.Text: This'll give a big boost to both the wearer's defence and their wisdom!

Txt_Item_SpecGuideHermes_Hat.Text: Pop this on if you need to protect yourself against wind spells.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideOrtegas_Helm.Text:
Now, this helm's really something. You're less likely to be bedazzled, put to sleep or affected by any annoying spells while wearing it.<KEY_WAIT>
It's almost as if the helmet itself longs to protect its wearer... Ha, imagine that: headgear with a will of its own!

Txt_Item_SpecGuideMask_Of_Implacability.Text:
This'll boost your defence if you choose to wear it, but it will also make you constantly confused.<KEY_WAIT>
I wouldn't let yourself, or anyone else for that matter, risk putting it on, frankly...

Txt_Item_SpecGuideMad_Cap.Text:
A rather nifty hat indeed. It reduces the MP its wearer requires to cast spells.<KEY_WAIT>
The ideal gift for anyone who relies on their magical might in battles.

Txt_Item_SpecGuidePhantom_Mask.Text:
This marvellous mask makes it easier for the wearer to dodge attacks aimed at them.<KEY_WAIT>
However, this doesn't hold true for spells and breath attacks, so don't be thinking you can just switch off during fights.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideBunny_Ears.Text: These really are just a pair of rabbit ears, but who hasn't wanted to pretend they're a hopping hare from time to time? ...No? Just me, then.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideHapless_Helm.Text: I don't know about you, but I already feel hapless enough without wearing a helm that'll doom me to a life of bad luck.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideThinking_Cap.Text:
The boost to your wisdom that this provides will do wonders for your spell casting.<KEY_WAIT>
Be sure to give this to someone who likes to flex their magical might in a fight.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideLight_Helm.Text: Ah, this can only be worn by a true hero of the realm. Apparently, it gives the wearer's lightning spells a beefy boost.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideStar_Circlet.Text: Pop this on and you'll be less likely to have your spells sealed away or your MP drained!

Txt_Item_SpecGuideDuplic_Hat.Text:
Oh, this one's special. It can cause any spell the wearer casts to echo and take effect twice!<KEY_WAIT>
And that's for the same amount of MP as if you cast it once.<KEY_WAIT>
Honestly, you'd struggle to find a better deal if you tried!

Txt_Item_SpecGuideHeavenly_Helm.Text: Not only does this helm provide ample protection, it also makes you less susceptible to confusion, bedazzlement, poisoning and averts insta-death.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideLeather_Armour.Text: Pretty basic stuff, but first-time adventurers would bite your hand off if you offered them this suit of armour for free.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideTortoise_Shell.Text: A word of warning to you: if you fall over with this on, just make sure you don't end up on your back.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideBoxer_Shorts.Text: These certainly wouldn't be my first choice if I were looking for a pair of pants...

Txt_Item_SpecGuideCloak_Of_Evasion.Text:
This'll make it much easier for you to dodge enemy attacks.<KEY_WAIT>
Sadly, that doesn't include spells and breath attacks, so do keep your wits about you.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideLeather_Dress.Text: Surprisingly flexible for something made of leather, and yet still more than tough enough!

Txt_Item_SpecGuideMagical_Skirt.Text:
This little number lessens the damage done by enemy spells while giving your defence a boost too.<KEY_WAIT>
Be sure to give it a try if you're the skirt-wearing type!

Txt_Item_SpecGuideSilk_Robe.Text: You've not lived till you've worn a garment like this. Just feel how soft it is on your skin!

Txt_Item_SpecGuideFizzle_Retardant_Suit.Text: This super suit can save you from having your spells sealed away. Handy, eh?

Txt_Item_SpecGuideMagical_Robes.Text: This'll reduce the damage dealt by any enemy spell that happens to hit you.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideMagic_Armour.Text: This'll reduce the damage dealt by any enemy spell that happens to hit you.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideParty_Dress.Text: Go ahead and pop this on if you fancy being the centre of attention!

Txt_Item_SpecGuideSmart_Suit.Text:
Ah, don't be expecting this to bestow any fancy effects on you in battle or anything.<KEY_WAIT>
It's just an incredibly well-made suit. What I wouldn't give to have one of my own...

Txt_Item_SpecGuideWizards_Robe.Text: Not only will this help protect you from having your spells sealed away, it also increases your wisdom!

Txt_Item_SpecGuideAgility_Gilet.Text: This'll give a nice boost to your agility and your defence.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideEarthenwear.Text: The ideal choice if you want something that'll provide you with ample protection.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideCat_Suit.Text: Ever dreamed of being someone's feline friend? Well, dream no more!

Txt_Item_SpecGuideAngels_Robe.Text: This ought to save you from spells which would normally be the end of you.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideSpiked_Armour.Text: This armour sends half the damage of any physical enemy attacks right back where it came from.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideInfernal_Armour.Text: Sure, this suit of armour will protect you in a pinch, but it has this nasty habit of randomly stopping whoever wears it dead in their tracks.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideScandalous_Swimsuit.Text: Quite the look, isn't it? Don't think I could pull it off, personally...

Txt_Item_SpecGuideFlame_Armour.Text:
This armour will reduce any damage dealt by ice attacks.<KEY_WAIT>
Thankfully, that applies to both spells and breath attacks alike.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideFlowing_Dress.Text:
This fabulous frock reduces damage from attacks of a fiery, icy or explosive nature.<KEY_WAIT>
Thankfully, that applies to both spells and breath attacks alike.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideBandit_Mail.Text: Not the flashiest of armour, but you'll struggle to find something so light that provides this level of protection.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideAuroral_Armour.Text:
This armour will boost your defences against all enemy offensive spells as well as fiery and icy breath attacks.<KEY_WAIT>
Oh, and that's not all: any wounds you have will slowly heal as you walk too!

Txt_Item_SpecGuideDragon_Robe.Text: This will lower damage dealt by enemy fire and ice breath attacks.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideShimmering_Dress.Text:
This darling dress reduces the damage dealt by all manner of enemy attacks.<KEY_WAIT>
You won't have to worry nearly as much about spells or breath attacks of an icy or fiery nature.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideBlessed_Bikini.Text: This will heal any wounds you have while you walk!

Txt_Item_SpecGuideDark_Robe.Text:
Pop this on and you'll find dodging enemy attacks to be a little bit easier.<KEY_WAIT>
That said, it won't help with evading spells or breath attacks, sadly.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideGlombolero.Text: An ideal present for anyone who relies on magic; this halves the MP needed to use spells or abilities!

Txt_Item_SpecGuideCorsairs_Coat.Text: Not only can this keep you safe from enemy wind spells, it'll also boost your agility.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideYggdrasil_Dress_Coat.Text:
Ideal for any spell caster who finds themselves having their MP drained, spells sealed away or being confused.<KEY_WAIT>
It can protect the wearer from all of that!

Txt_Item_SpecGuideExotoga.Text: This will reduce the damage dealt by all enemy spells and make you less likely to be poisoned, paralysed or put to sleep.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideGodbird_Armour.Text:
This armour reflects half the damage done by physical enemy attacks.<KEY_WAIT>
What's more, it also heals your wounds each time you take a turn. Pretty godly, indeed...

Txt_Item_SpecGuideStrength_Ring.Text:
Does what it says on the tin really. Pop it on your finger if you feel your strength needs boosting.<KEY_WAIT>
It might turn you into a bit of a meathead, mind you.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideTough_Guy_Tattoo.Text:
Go ahead and sport this if you think you need to do more damage.<KEY_WAIT>
Just don't be surprised when people start treating you like a bit of a thug.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideMighty_Armlet.Text:
Put this on your arm if you fancy doing more damage in battle.<KEY_WAIT>
It might even cause people to start seeing you as a paragon to boot.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideGarter.Text: This little number will have you feeling like a real vamp if you wear it.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideDoh_Hican.Text: No offence if this is your style, but sport a haircut like this and some people might think you're being a clown.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideGold_Rosary.Text: Careful if you put this on<--->you're likely to turn into a bit of a daydreamer as you stare at your reflection in the solid silver links.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideLeg_Warmers.Text: Not only will these thick socks keep your ankles and calves toasty, they'll also raise your defence.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideTen_Ton_Toupee.Text: Anyone who wears headgear as heavy as this must be stubborn as a mule.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideCower_Ring.Text:
This ring increases its wearer's agilty.
<KEY_WAIT>
...But it comes at a price<--->it also proves they're too much of a wimp to fight their foes head-on.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideSkull_Ring.Text: Anyone wearing a ring like this is a <b>lone wolf</> who rarely, if ever, plays by the rules.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideAgility_Ring.Text:
This particular ring raises its wearer's agility<--->no surprises there.
<KEY_WAIT>
Without doubt, this is the ideal accessory for a wannabe acrobat.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideMercurys_Bandana.Text:
This stylish item raises its wearer's agility.
<KEY_WAIT>
It's bound to make them move like lightning and earn a reputation as a bat out of hell.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideMeteorite_Bracer.Text: This is an exceptional armband that raises its wearer's agility to extraterrestrial levels.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideGold_Chain.Text: This fetching necklace will turn even the most introverted adventurer into a bona fide charmer.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideRestless_Heart.Text: This unusual accessory marks its bearer as a plugger whose courage, for better or worse, never wanes in the face of adversity.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideTitan_Belt.Text:
Wearing this special belt will let you do more damage in battle.<KEY_WAIT>
People might even start calling you a tough cookie if they see it clinging to your waist.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideScholars_Specs.Text:
Besides exuding bookish charm, these spectacles will instantly raise the wisdom of whoever puts them on.
<KEY_WAIT>
They'll even turn you into a true wit apparently.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideCare_Ring.Text: Slip this on your finger and everyone will see what a good egg you are<--->someone who really cares about their friends.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideGoddess_Ring.Text: With this ring on your finger, every step you take will restore a little MP. Outward displays of devotion can have their benefits it seems!

Txt_Item_SpecGuideBunny_Tail.Text:
This adorable accessory adorns the posterior and raises the luck of its wearer.
<KEY_WAIT>
It's impossible not to be a happy camper with this tail decorating your derriere.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideGolden_Tiara.Text: Putting this delicate accessory on your head might not turn you into royalty, but it will make you want to prance about like an aristocrat.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideHens_Tooth.Text:
Keep this rare item on your person to raise your luck.
<KEY_WAIT>
But a word of caution: people may begin to envy you as something of a lucky devil.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideSacred_Amulet.Text: When this adorns your person, you'll be protected from magic spells that would normally send you to the hereafter.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideElevating_Shoes.Text: Every step you take in these lovely loafers will earn you a modicum of experience points to help you level up!

Txt_Item_SpecGuidePacifier.Text: No matter your age, pop this in your mouth and soon enough everyone will be calling you a spoilt brat.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideSlime_Earrings.Text: The perfect jewelry for a budding socialite looking to associate with the upper crust.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideRuby_Wristband.Text: It's a beautiful piece, but wearing jewelry like this is likely to lead to people calling you a show-off.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideSages_Stone.Text: This remarkable rock can be used in battle to restore the health of all your party members.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideHoly_Water.Text: You can also use it in battle to inflict damage on an enemy.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideTangleweb.Text: Using a ball of this in battle can lower the agility of a group of enemies.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideOomph_Powder.Text: You can use a sprinkle of this stuff in battle to significantly raise the attack of a single ally.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideDieamend.Text: If you're holding one of these and an enemy casts a spell that would normally be the end of you, your life will be saved at the expense of the stone.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideFail_Is_A_Four_Letter_.Text: It seems you can learn to hate losing just by reading this.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideThe_Saddest_Story_Ever.Text: It's a collection of sorrowful short stories that will have you blubbering like a baby before the end.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideTears_Before_Bedtime.Text: This seems to be a guide book on how to get your own way whenever you want. Says it works every time...

Txt_Item_SpecGuideLoving_Living_A_Grinne.Text: It's a self-help book filled with ways to bring more good fortune to your life.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideComedy_Book.Text: It's a joke book containing humourous tales and groan-worthy puns from throughout history.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideDiary_Of_A_Hardman.Text: This seems to be a comprehensive training regimen geared towards gym-goers.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideThe_Girls_Own_Annual.Text: It looks like some kind of manual for helping kids have some fun by getting up to mischief.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideCheater_Book.Text: It's a book containing advice on how to cheat your way through life. Who would publish something like this?

Txt_Item_SpecGuideBenice_Book.Text: Oh, it's a lovely book about how to be nicer to others and show more compassion.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideLeap_Before_You_Look.Text: This book says it can turn any shrinking violet into an attention-seeking show-off. I just hope it draws the line between courage and foolhardiness.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideSmart_Book.Text: Not only does this book claim to make you smarter, it also explores how you can put your brain to better use.

Txt_Item_SpecGuidePrimms_Primer.Text: It's a magnificent manual that goes into minute detail about correct manners and how to maintain proper decorum.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideThe_Champions_Code.Text: This wonderful book lays bare the secrets on how to live fearlessly and extract the most out of what life has to offer.

Txt_Item_SpecGuidePouch_Of_Musk.Text: If you use a pouch of this, monsters will come flocking to you<--->they can smell it a mile off.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideNight_Light.Text: It's some kind of lantern that can be used to speed up time and turn day into night.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideWar_Drum.Text: Banging on this instrument during battle will significantly raise the attack of everyone in your party.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideAdventurers_Map.Text: This handy piece of parchment shows a map of the entire world. If you look closely, you can even see detailed diagrams of each region.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideFaerie_Map.Text: This parchment shows a map of the entirety of Alefgard. On closer inspection, it even has intricate layouts of each area.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideWrecking_Ball.Text: I'm very sorry, but I really can't tell what this thing does. Perhaps you could see what happens when you try using it.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideDreamstone.Text: This is a jaw-dropping jewel, make no mistake, but when I look into it, I feel as though I'm about to lose consciousness...

Txt_Item_SpecGuideBlack_Pepper.Text: If some of this spicy stuff gets up your nose, it'll make you sneeze your head off.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideMod_Rod.Text: This magical staff can be used to change your appearance in a wide variety of ways.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideLovers_Locket.Text: This is a precious pendant that symbolises the loving memories shared by Eric and Olivia.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideThiefs_Key.Text: This key would appear to open many a locked door.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideEcho_Flute.Text: The soft sound of this instrument feels like it ought to elicit a response from something, though I couldn't say what.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideRed_Orb.Text: This is a truly beautiful jewel, the like of which I've never seen before. It has a real otherworldly quality to it...

Txt_Item_SpecGuideFaerie_Flute.Text: If you play this instrument in battle, it can put an entire group of enemies to sleep.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideSunstone.Text: It seems this rock can be used in battle to awaken all sleeping party members from their slumber.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideOrichalcum.Text: This marvellous metal shines with a strange brilliance. Perhaps you could use it to forge something.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideBroken_Sword.Text:
This blade has seen better days. My heart tells me it should be reforged into the magnificent weapon it once was...<KEY_WAIT>
I wonder if there's a blacksmith out there who'd be willing to mend it...

Txt_Item_SpecGuideHammer_Of_Gaia.Text: With a tool like this, a skilled smith could make even a mythical metal bend to their will.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideBLUE_METAL.Text:
This metal is not only beautiful to look at, it's also extremely hard and robust<--->without doubt the finest I've ever seen.<KEY_WAIT>
However, by my best estimates, this isn't an easy material to work with. I doubt anyone could make much use of it...

Txt_Item_SpecGuideGolden_Medal.Text: I don't know where you acquired this marvellous medal, but it shows that you must've gone on quite the adventure, {HERO}!

Txt_Item_SpecGuideAmulet_Bell.Text: The tinkling of this little bell seems to somehow help ward off a variety of ailments.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideHoly_Symbol_Of_Amulet.Text: With this on your finger, you'll be better protected against spells that would ordinarily kill you in an instant.

Txt_Item_SpecGuidePoison_Resistance_Neck.Text: It's fairly plain, but it seems to be enchanted to protect the wearer from getting poisoned.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideSealing_Resistance_Nec.Text: Hang this round your neck and your spells won't be sealed away as frequently as they normally would.

Txt_Item_SpecGuidePhantom_Resistance_Nec.Text: With this round your neck, you're less likely to be bedazzled.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideAlarm_Ring.Text: It's a ring imbued with magic to help keep you awake when an enemy would rather have you nod off.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideMangetsu_Ring.Text: The magic in this ring'll help prevent paralysis and keep your body lithe and limber when it matters.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideRing_Of_Reason.Text: This'll help stop you getting confused at inopportune moments.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideWind_Earrings.Text: Not only are they nice to look at, these earrings will counteract some of the damage from an enemy's wind attacks.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideContinent_Map.Text: And that's about it really. All of Aliahan's noteworthy landmarks ought to be on there somewhere.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideCOMMON1.Text: When we talk of items with extraordinary properties...<IfPlrNoun_I_NAME(these things don't,this thing doesn't)> even enter the conversation.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideCOMMON2.Text: I'm not entirely sure what <IfPlrNoun_I_NAME(these do,this thing does)>. You'd be better off using <IfPlrNoun_I_NAME(them,it)> and finding out for yourself.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideOrochis_Sword_F.Text: In case you were curious, you can use this as an item in battle to lower the enemy's defence.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideZombiesbane_F.Text: This weapon'll deal decent damage to undead creatures.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideMountaincleaver_F.Text:
Hmm, something tells me this sword is more than just a weapon...<KEY_WAIT>
But staring at it's not going to give us the answers. There must be someone out there who knows more about it, surely.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideDragonsbane_F.Text: These claws'll deal decent damage to creatures from the dragon family.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideThunderbolt_Blade_F.Text: You can use this as an item in battle to unleash a great big blast that'll hit all enemies that stand before you.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideSiren_Sword_F.Text: In case you were curious, you can use this as an item in battle to confuse the enemy.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideSword_Of_Ruin_F.Text: You can deal plenty of damage with this, but I'm not too sure it's worth all the misfortune that's said to befall the wielder...

Txt_Item_SpecGuideBlizzard_Blade_F.Text: You can use this as an item in battle to unleash a blustering blizzard on your foes.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideSword_Of_Kings_F.Text: Ah, you're in for a treat if you use this as an item in battle; it summons two tornadoes that'll rip apart the enemy!

Txt_Item_SpecGuideFalcon_Blade_F.Text: Lets you unleash two attacks for the price of one! Not a bad deal, eh?

Txt_Item_SpecGuideStormlords_Sword_F.Text: Go ahead and use this as an item in battle if you fancy making your foes feel nice and toasty.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideDouble-Edged_Sword_F.Text:
Be sure to think twice before you equip this, alright? Removing it from your person after you wield it once is easier said than done...<KEY_WAIT>
I mean, I do understand the temptation; not many blades cut quite so cleanly, but I'd steer clear of it personally.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideRubisss_Sword_F.Text: Your enemies are in for an almighty shock if you use this as an item in battle.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideHeadsmans_Axe_F.Text: Word has it anyone who wields this can unleash critical hits and miss their target completely in almost equal measure.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideConquerors_Axe_F.Text: Something tells me this gear will pack an almighty punch in a fight.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideSandstorm_Spear_F.Text: Use this as an item in battle if you want to bedazzle your foes with a sweeping sandstorm.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideDemon_Spear_F.Text: This can take out an enemy in one hit...if it strikes them in the right place, at least.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideGodly_Poker_F.Text: A fairly standard weapon that just happens to deal ludicrous amounts of damage.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideGolden_Claws_F.Text: Oh, do be warned: just having these on you attracts all kinds of baddies down in the depths of the pyramid.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideFire_Claws_F.Text: Ah, you can use these as an item in battle to bathe an enemy in fire.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideBeast_Claws_F.Text: These are incredibly effective against beast-family enemies, you know.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideWizards_Staff_F.Text: You can use this as an item in battle to send fire flying out of the jewel on the staff towards a baddy.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideStaff_Of_Antimagic_F.Text: Ah, now this is a useful staff to have: you can use it as an item in battle to seal away enemies' spells.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideSomatic_Staff_F.Text: Anyone wielding this will use up some MP every time they attack, so try to only go on the front foot when it matters.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideStaff_Of_Sentencing_F.Text: You can use this as an item in battle to let loose the full force of the wind on the enemy.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideLightning_Staff_F.Text:
Did you know you can use this in a battle to set the very earth on fire?<KEY_WAIT>
What's more, you don't even need to know any magic to use it!<KEY_WAIT>
Pretty nifty, eh?

Txt_Item_SpecGuideSnooze_Stick_F.Text: Ha, I've always liked this one. You can use it as an item in battle to unleash a sweet aroma that sends enemies off to the land of Nod.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideStaff_Of_Rain_F.Text:
This'll come in handy as an item in battle if you need to seal away somebody's spells.<KEY_WAIT>
It's funny, its name just made me think of how nice it is when the rain stops, the sun comes out and you're greeted by a big rainbow.<KEY_WAIT>
I wonder what might happen if you had another item connected to the sun... Sorry, just thinking out loud.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideSages_Staff_F.Text: In case you were wondering, this can be used as an item in battle to heal your allies' wounds.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideStaff_Of_Strife_F.Text:
Try using this as an item in battle if you want to surround yourself with a spell-deflecting barrier.<KEY_WAIT>
Oh, but do remember: it'll reflect all spells. Even ones cast on you by your allies.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideStaff_Of_Resurrection_.Text:
This special little staff can resurrect fallen allies when used as an item in battle.<KEY_WAIT>
Just keep in mind I said <6>can<9>, though. It's not guaranteed to bring people back. I suppose <6>staff of occasional resurrection<9> wouldn't sound as good...

Txt_Item_SpecGuideGodbird_Sceptre_F.Text:
You can use this staff as an item in battle to summon an enormous ball of fire that'll come crashing down on an enemy.<KEY_WAIT>
And that's not all: when you hit an enemy with it you'll absorb some of their MP!

Txt_Item_SpecGuideAurora_Staff_F.Text:
Ah, this staff really stands out from the rest. When you use it as an item in battle it not only removes all beneficial effects from enemies, it also neutralises all negative effects affecting allies.<KEY_WAIT>
Monsters are going to think twice before picking a fight as long as you've got this.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideAstraeas_Abacus_F.Text: Best leave this one to us merchants. We know how to get the best out of it.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideChain_Sickle_F.Text: Long enough that you'd expect it to hit multiple enemies in one go, but sadly it only damages one per attack.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideThorn_Whip_F.Text: This'll come in handy if you want to hit multiple enemies with each attack!

Txt_Item_SpecGuideChain_Whip_Items_F.Text: I suggest wielding this if you want to whack several foes in one go.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideBeastly_Bullwhip_F.Text: Not only does this whip let you hit multiple enemies in one go, it also deals plenty of pain to enemies from the beast family.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideDragontail_Whip_F.Text: Not only does this whip let you hit multiple enemies in one go, it also deals plenty of pain to enemies from the dragon family.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideEmpresss_Whip_F.Text: Not only does this whip let you hit multiple enemies in one go, it also deals plenty of pain to humanoid-family enemies.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideGringham_Whip_F.Text: This can whack a bunch of baddies in one go just like all the other whips.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideDestructiball_F.Text: Unsurprisingly, capable of destroying more or less anything in its path.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideBoomerang_F.Text: This'll hit all the enemies you're facing, but it deals slightly less damage to every foe it hits after the first one.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideEdged_Boomerang_F.Text: This'll hit all the enemies you're facing, but it deals slightly less damage to every foe it hits after the first one.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideGusterang_F.Text:
As the name suggests, this brilliant boomerang is imbued with the power of the wind.<KEY_WAIT>
It'll hit all the enemies you're facing, but it deals slightly less damage to every foe it hits after the first one.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideSwallowtail_F.Text:
This brilliant boomerang deals plenty of pain to foes from the insect family.<KEY_WAIT>
It'll hit all the enemies you're facing, but it deals slightly less damage to every foe it hits after the first one.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideFlametang_Boomerang_F.Text:
Ah, this one's a fiery little number.<KEY_WAIT>
It'll hit all the enemies you're facing, but it deals slightly less damage to every foe it hits after the first one.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideMetal_Wing_Boomerang_F.Text:
You'll definitely want this to hand if you're going up against metallic monsters; it's guaranteed to hit any metal-bodied foes, and often lands a critical hit in the process!<KEY_WAIT>
There aren't many better boomerangs out there for my money.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideHunters_Moon_F.Text:
I know what you're going to say: you don't like boomerangs 'cause you can't pile on the pain if you're up against a load of enemies.<KEY_WAIT>
But what would you say if I told you this one was different? Yes, that's right: it deals the same amount of damage to all foes foolish enough to stand in its path!

Txt_Item_SpecGuidePot_Lid_F.Text:
I mean, sure, this'll help you defend yourself...kind of.<KEY_WAIT>
But honestly, I'd hurry up and find something better if I were you.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideSilver_Platter_F.Text: Not only will this protect you, it'll also make you feel fantastically fancy!

Txt_Item_SpecGuideIce_Shield_F.Text:
Keep <IfPlrNoun_I_NAME(these earrings,this)> handy if you think you might be facing an enemy that can unleash fiery attacks.<KEY_WAIT>
Luckily, it's effective against both spells and breath attacks to boot.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideMagic_Shield_F.Text: Reduces the damage dealt by any offensive spell an enemy casts on you.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideDragon_Shield_F.Text: Equip this if you want some extra protection against breath attacks of a fiery or icy nature.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideTempest_Shield_F.Text: You won't do much better than this if you need to guard yourself against explosive spells.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideFlame_Shield_F.Text:
<IfPlrNoun_I_NAME(These earrings,This shield)> can bear the brunt of ice attacks so they do less damage to the wielder.<KEY_WAIT>
Thankfully, that applies to both spells and breath attacks alike.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideMirror_Shield_F.Text:
Ah, yes, this can reflect spells the same way it reflects your face back at you if you stand in front of it.<KEY_WAIT>
Though, remember: it reflects all spells, regardless of who cast them.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideOgre_Shield_F.Text: This shield doesn't have any fancy powers or anything, but few bucklers out there will provide you with this level of protection.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideShield_Of_Shame_F.Text:
Sure, this'll protect you from attacks. It's just, well...<KEY_WAIT>
The damage you would've taken from the blow will get dumped on one of your friends instead.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideGoddess_Shield_F.Text: This divine shield lessens the damage dealt by enemy spells and breath attacks of a fiery or icy nature.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideTurban_F.Text: Honestly, there's nothing inherently special about this turban, but don't you just feel ready to make your fortune the second you pop it on?

Txt_Item_SpecGuideHardwood_Headwear_F.Text: Far from the fanciest of headgear, but beginner adventurers swear by it.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideKings_Crown_F.Text: You know, I'm starting to realise why Robbin' 'Ood was so keen on pinching this. It must be made of pure gold...

Txt_Item_SpecGuideScholars_Cap_F.Text: This'll give a big boost to both the wearer's defence and their wisdom!

Txt_Item_SpecGuideHermes_Hat_F.Text: Pop this on if you need to protect yourself against wind spells.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideOrtegas_Helm_F.Text:
Now, this helm's really something. You're less likely to be bedazzled, put to sleep or affected by any annoying spells while wearing it.<KEY_WAIT>
It's almost as if the helmet itself longs to protect its wearer... Ha, imagine that: headgear with a will of its own!

Txt_Item_SpecGuideMask_Of_Implacability_.Text:
This'll boost your defence if you choose to wear it, but it will also make you constantly confused.<KEY_WAIT>
I wouldn't let yourself, or anyone else for that matter, risk putting it on, frankly...

Txt_Item_SpecGuideMad_Cap_F.Text:
A rather nifty hat indeed. It reduces the MP its wearer requires to cast spells.<KEY_WAIT>
The ideal gift for anyone who relies on their magical might in battles.

Txt_Item_SpecGuidePhantom_Mask_F.Text:
This marvellous mask makes it easier for the wearer to dodge attacks aimed at them.<KEY_WAIT>
However, this doesn't hold true for spells and breath attacks, so don't be thinking you can just switch off during fights.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideBunny_Ears_F.Text: These really are just a pair of rabbit ears, but who hasn't wanted to pretend they're a hopping hare from time to time? ...No? Just me, then.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideHapless_Helm_F.Text: I don't know about you, but I already feel hapless enough without wearing a helm that'll doom me to a life of bad luck.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideThinking_Cap_F.Text:
The boost to your wisdom that this provides will do wonders for your spell casting.<KEY_WAIT>
Be sure to give this to someone who likes to flex their magical might in a fight.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideLight_Helm_F.Text: Ah, this can only be worn by a true hero of the realm. Apparently, it gives the wearer's lightning spells a beefy boost.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideStar_Circlet_F.Text: Pop this on and you'll be less likely to have your spells sealed away or your MP drained!

Txt_Item_SpecGuideDuplic_Hat_F.Text:
Oh, this one's special. It can cause any spell the wearer casts to echo and take effect twice!<KEY_WAIT>
And that's for the same amount of MP as if you cast it once.<KEY_WAIT>
Honestly, you'd struggle to find a better deal if you tried!

Txt_Item_SpecGuideHeavenly_Helm_F.Text: Not only does this helm provide ample protection, it also makes you less susceptible to confusion, bedazzlement, poisoning and averts insta-death.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideLeather_Armour_F.Text: Pretty basic stuff, but first-time adventurers would bite your hand off if you offered them this suit of armour for free.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideTortoise_Shell_F.Text: A word of warning to you: if you fall over with this on, just make sure you don't end up on your back.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideBoxer_Shorts_F.Text: Hmm, not the most attractive under-garments, are they...

Txt_Item_SpecGuideCloak_Of_Evasion_F.Text:
This'll make it much easier for you to dodge enemy attacks.<KEY_WAIT>
Sadly, that doesn't include spells and breath attacks, so do keep your wits about you.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideLeather_Dress_F.Text: Surprisingly flexible for something made of leather, and yet still more than tough enough!

Txt_Item_SpecGuideMagical_Skirt_F.Text:
This little number lessens the damage done by enemy spells while giving your defence a boost too.<KEY_WAIT>
Be sure to give it a try if you're the skirt-wearing type!

Txt_Item_SpecGuideSilk_Robe_F.Text: You've not lived till you've worn a garment like this. Just feel how soft it is on your skin!

Txt_Item_SpecGuideFizzle_Retardant_Suit_.Text: This super suit can save you from having your spells sealed away. Handy, eh?

Txt_Item_SpecGuideMagical_Robes_F.Text: This'll reduce the damage dealt by any enemy spell that happens to hit you.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideMagic_Armour_F.Text: This'll reduce the damage dealt by any enemy spell that happens to hit you.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideParty_Dress_F.Text: Go ahead and pop this on if you fancy being the centre of attention!

Txt_Item_SpecGuideSmart_Suit_F.Text:
Ah, don't be expecting this to bestow any fancy effects on you in battle or anything.<KEY_WAIT>
It's just an incredibly well-made suit. What I wouldn't give to have one of my own...

Txt_Item_SpecGuideWizards_Robe_F.Text: Not only will this help protect you from having your spells sealed away, it also increases your wisdom!

Txt_Item_SpecGuideAgility_Gilet_F.Text: This'll give a nice boost to your agility and your defence.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideEarthenwear_F.Text: The ideal choice if you want something that'll provide you with ample protection.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideCat_Suit_F.Text: Ever dreamed of being someone's feline friend? Well, dream no more!

Txt_Item_SpecGuideAngels_Robe_F.Text: This ought to save you from spells which would normally be the end of you.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideSpiked_Armour_F.Text: This armour sends half the damage of any physical enemy attacks right back where it came from.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideInfernal_Armour_F.Text: Sure, this suit of armour will protect you in a pinch, but it has this nasty habit of randomly stopping whoever wears it dead in their tracks.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideScandalous_Swimsuit_F.Text: I'd love nothing more than to throw this on and go for a swim in the sea!

Txt_Item_SpecGuideFlame_Armour_F.Text:
This armour will reduce any damage dealt by ice attacks.<KEY_WAIT>
Thankfully, that applies to both spells and breath attacks alike.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideFlowing_Dress_F.Text:
This fabulous frock reduces damage from attacks of a fiery, icy or explosive nature.<KEY_WAIT>
Thankfully, that applies to both spells and breath attacks alike.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideBandit_Mail_F.Text: Not the flashiest of armour, but you'll struggle to find something so light that provides this level of protection.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideAuroral_Armour_F.Text:
This armour will boost your defences against all enemy offensive spells as well as fire and ice breath attacks.<KEY_WAIT>
Oh, and that's not all: any wounds you have will slowly heal as you walk too!

Txt_Item_SpecGuideDragon_Robe_F.Text: This will lower damage dealt by enemy fire and ice breath attacks.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideShimmering_Dress_F.Text:
This darling dress reduces the damage dealt by all manner of enemy attacks.<KEY_WAIT>
You won't have to worry nearly as much about spells or breath attacks of an icy or fiery nature.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideBlessed_Bikini_F.Text: This will heal any wounds you have while you walk!

Txt_Item_SpecGuideDark_Robe_F.Text:
Pop this on and you'll find dodging enemy attacks to be a little bit easier.<KEY_WAIT>
That said, it won't help with evading spells or breath attacks, sadly.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideGlombolero_F.Text: An ideal present for anyone who relies on magic; this halves the MP needed to use spells or abilities!

Txt_Item_SpecGuideCorsairs_Coat_F.Text: Not only can this keep you safe from enemy wind spells, it'll also boost your agility.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideYggdrasil_Dress_Coat_F.Text:
Ideal for any spell caster who finds themselves having their MP drained, spells sealed away or being confused.<KEY_WAIT>
It can protect the wearer from all of that!

Txt_Item_SpecGuideExotoga_F.Text: This will reduce the damage dealt by all enemy spells and make you less likely to be poisoned, paralysed or put to sleep.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideGodbird_Armour_F.Text:
This armour reflects half the damage done by physical enemy attacks.<KEY_WAIT>
What's more, it also heals your wounds each time you take a turn. Pretty godly, indeed...

Txt_Item_SpecGuideStrength_Ring_F.Text:
Does what it says on the tin really. Pop it on your finger if you feel your strength needs boosting.<KEY_WAIT>
It might turn you into a bit of a meathead, mind you.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideTough_Guy_Tattoo_F.Text:
Go ahead and sport this if you think you need to do more damage.<KEY_WAIT>
Just don't be surprised when people start treating you like a bit of a thug.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideMighty_Armlet_F.Text:
Put this on your arm if you fancy doing more damage in battle.<KEY_WAIT>
It might even cause people to start seeing you as a paragon to boot.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideGarter_F.Text: This little number will have you feeling like a real vamp if you wear it.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideDoh_Hican_F.Text: No offence if this is your cup of tea, but a haircut like this might have some people thinking you're a bit of a clown.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideGold_Rosary_F.Text: Careful if you put this on<--->you're likely to turn into a bit of a daydreamer as you stare at your reflection in the solid silver links.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideLeg_Warmers_F.Text: Not only will these thick socks keep your ankles and calves toasty, they'll also raise your defence.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideTen_Ton_Toupee_F.Text: Anyone who wears headgear as heavy as this must be stubborn as a mule.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideCower_Ring_F.Text:
This ring increases its wearer's agilty.
<KEY_WAIT>
...But it comes at a price<--->it also proves they're too much of a wimp to fight their foes head-on.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideSkull_Ring_F.Text: Anyone wearing a ring like this is a lone wolf who rarely, if ever, plays by the rules.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideAgility_Ring_F.Text:
This particular ring raises its wearer's agility<--->no surprises there.
<KEY_WAIT>
Without doubt, this is the perfect accessory for a budding acrobat.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideMercurys_Bandana_F.Text:
This stylish item raises its wearer's agility.
<KEY_WAIT>
It's bound to make them move like lightning and earn a reputation as a bat out of hell.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideMeteorite_Bracer_F.Text: This is an exceptional armband that raises its wearer's agility to extraterrestrial levels.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideGold_Chain_F.Text: This fetching necklace will turn even the most introverted adventurer into a bona fide charmer.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideRestless_Heart_F.Text: This unusual accessory marks its bearer as a plugger whose courage, for better or worse, never wanes in the face of adversity.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideTitan_Belt_F.Text:
Wearing this special belt will let you do more damage in battle.<KEY_WAIT>
People might even start calling you a tough cookie if they see it clinging to your waist.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideScholars_Specs_F.Text:
Besides exuding bookish charm, these spectacles will instantly raise the wisdom of whoever puts them on.
<KEY_WAIT>
They'll even turn you into a true wit apparently.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideCare_Ring_F.Text: Slip this on your finger and everyone will see what a good egg you are<--->someone who really cares about their friends.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideGoddess_Ring_F.Text: With this ring on your finger, every step you take will restore a little MP. Outward displays of devotion can have their benefits, it seems!

Txt_Item_SpecGuideBunny_Tail_F.Text:
This adorable accessory adorns the posterior and raises the luck of its wearer.
<KEY_WAIT>
It's impossible not to be a happy camper with this tail decorating your derriere.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideGolden_Tiara_F.Text: Putting this delicate accessory on your head might not turn you into royalty, but it will make you feel like an aristocrat.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideHens_Tooth_F.Text:
Keep this rare item on your person to raise your luck.
<KEY_WAIT>
But a word of caution: people may begin to envy you as something of a lucky devil.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideSacred_Amulet_F.Text: When this adorns your person, you'll be protected from magic spells that would normally send you to the hereafter.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideElevating_Shoes_F.Text: Every step you take in these lovely loafers will earn you a modicum of experience points to help you level up!

Txt_Item_SpecGuidePacifier_F.Text: No matter your age, pop this in your mouth and soon enough everyone will be calling you a spoilt brat.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideSlime_Earrings_F.Text: The perfect jewelry for a budding socialite looking to associate with the upper crust.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideRuby_Wristband_F.Text: It's a beautiful piece, but people will start calling you a show-off if you flash jewelry like this.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideSages_Stone_F.Text: This remarkable rock can be used in battle to restore the health of everyone in your party.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideHoly_Water_F.Text: You can also use it in battle to inflict damage on an enemy.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideTangleweb_F.Text: Using a ball of this in battle can lower the agility of a group of enemies.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideOomph_Powder_F.Text: You can use a sprinkle of this stuff in battle to significantly raise the attack of a single ally.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideDieamend_F.Text: If you're holding one of these and an enemy casts a spell that would normally be the end of you, your life will be saved at the expense of the stone.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideFail_Is_A_Four_Letter_.Text: It looks like reading this will inspire you to hate giving up almost as much as you hate losing!

Txt_Item_SpecGuideThe_Saddest_Story_Ever.Text: The blurb on the back says <6>anyone who fails to cry at these short stories isn't human<9>. I imagine you'll want to prepare a handkerchief before you start reading this.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideTears_Before_Bedtime_F.Text: It claims to teach adults how to become unbearable brats without being roundly hated for it... How is that even possible?

Txt_Item_SpecGuideLoving_Living_A_Grinne.Text: It makes the bold claim that reading it will improve your luck. I'll believe that when I see it...

Txt_Item_SpecGuideComedy_Book_F.Text: <6>Fortune favours those who smile! One hundred of history's favourite jokes!<9> Some of these are actually pretty funny...

Txt_Item_SpecGuideDiary_Of_A_Hardman_F.Text: <6>Do you want bulging biceps and a toned trapezius? Then read this book! Because strength matters!<9>

Txt_Item_SpecGuideThe_Girls_Own_Annual_F.Text: <6>Learn how to trick grown-ups and pull off perfect pranks on your friends. Keep out of reach of good children!<9> This book is dangerous...

Txt_Item_SpecGuideCheater_Book_F.Text: <6>Honesty is for idiots; smart people prefer deceipt!<9> I can't believe somebody wrote this thing...

Txt_Item_SpecGuideBenice_Book_F.Text: <6>Treat others as you would wish to be treated yourself.<9> What a pleasant little book.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideLeap_Before_You_Look_F.Text: <6>With any endeavour, the first step is often the hardest. This book will teach you how to turn those initial baby steps into great leaps of faith!<9>

Txt_Item_SpecGuideSmart_Book_F.Text: <6>Eat the brain-boosting foods in our patented diet plan and unlock the full potential of your mind! Learn about the power of <66>superthink<99>!<9> Wow.

Txt_Item_SpecGuidePrimms_Primer_F.Text: <6>Embody the sophistication that your breeding denied you, starting with proper table manners.<9> Well, we all have to start somewhere.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideThe_Champions_Code_F.Text: <6>Hone your confidence and learn how to win at life!<9> Sounds like a recipe for success.

Txt_Item_SpecGuidePouch_Of_Musk_F.Text: If you use a pouch of this, monsters will come flocking to you<--->they can smell it a mile off.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideNight_Light_F.Text: It seems to be a lantern that's used to turn day into night instantaneously.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideWar_Drum_F.Text: Banging on this instrument during battle will significantly raise the attack of everyone in your party.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideAdventurers_Map_F.Text: This handy piece of parchment shows a map of the entire world. If you look closely, you can even see detailed diagrams of each region.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideFaerie_Map_F.Text: This parchment shows a map of the entirety of Alefgard. On closer inspection, it even has intricate layouts of each area.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideWrecking_Ball_F.Text: Sorry, but I'm not quite sure what this does. Why don't you test it out for yourself?

Txt_Item_SpecGuideDreamstone_F.Text: This is a stunning gem, to be sure, though I feel it's trying to pull me inside... I dare not look at it for too long.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideBlack_Pepper_F.Text: This is a sought-after spice that's often used to enhance the flavour of any dish.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideMod_Rod_F.Text: This magical staff can be used to change your appearance in a wide variety of ways.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideLovers_Locket_F.Text: This treasured trinket tells a tale of the love that Eric and Olivia felt for one another.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideThiefs_Key_F.Text: You'll find you can open many locked doors with this key.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideEcho_Flute_F.Text: When this flute is played, certain objects will reverberate and respond by repeating the tune.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideRed_Orb_F.Text: What a gorgeous jewel! It looks so otherworldly.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideFaerie_Flute_F.Text: If you play this instrument in battle, it can put an entire group of enemies to sleep.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideSunstone_F.Text: It seems this rock can be used in battle to awaken all sleeping party members from their slumber.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideOrichalcum_F.Text: This metal has a beautiful sparkle to it. I wonder what it could be used for...

Txt_Item_SpecGuideBroken_Sword_F.Text:
This blade has seen better days. My heart tells me it should be reforged into the magnificent weapon it once was...<KEY_WAIT>
I wonder if there's a blacksmith out there who'd be willing to mend it...

Txt_Item_SpecGuideHammer_Of_Gaia_F.Text: With a tool like this, a skilled smith could make even a mythical metal bend to their will.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideBLUE_METAL_F.Text:
This metal is not only beautiful to look at, it's also extremely hard and robust<--->without doubt the finest metal I've ever seen.<KEY_WAIT>
However, by my best estimates, this isn't an easy material to work with. I doubt anyone could make much use of it...

Txt_Item_SpecGuideGolden_Medal_F.Text: I don't know where you acquired this marvellous medal, but it shows that you must've gone on quite the adventure, {HERO}!

Txt_Item_SpecGuideAmulet_Bell_F.Text: The tinkling of this little bell seems to somehow help ward off a variety of ailments.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideHoly_Symbol_Of_Amulet_.Text: With this on your finger, you'll be better protected against spells that would ordinarily kill you in an instant.

Txt_Item_SpecGuidePoison_Resistance_Neck.Text: It's fairly plain, but it seems to be enchanted to protect the wearer from getting poisoned.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideSealing_Resistance_Nec.Text: Hang this round your neck and your spells won't be sealed away as frequently as they normally would.

Txt_Item_SpecGuidePhantom_Resistance_Nec.Text: With this round your neck, you're less likely to be bedazzled.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideAlarm_Ring_F.Text: It's a ring imbued with magic to help keep you awake when an enemy would rather have you nod off.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideMangetsu_Ring_F.Text: The magic in this ring'll help prevent paralysis and keep your body lithe and limber when it matters.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideRing_Of_Reason_F.Text: This'll help stop you getting confused at inopportune moments.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideWind_Earrings_F.Text: Not only are they nice to look at, these earrings will counteract some of the damage from an enemy's wind attacks.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideContinent_Map_F.Text: And that's about it really. All of Aliahan's noteworthy landmarks ought to be on there somewhere.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideCOMMON1_F.Text: When we talk of items with extraordinary properties...<IfPlrNoun_I_NAME(these things don't,this thing doesn't)> even enter the conversation.

Txt_Item_SpecGuideCOMMON2_F.Text: I have no idea what <IfPlrNoun_I_NAME(these do,this thing does)>. Why don't you try using <IfPlrNoun_I_NAME(them,it)> and find out for yourself?

Txt_Item_Use_Count_common1.Text: The best thing about <IfPlrNoun_I_NAME(these,this)> is you can use <IfPlrNoun_I_NAME(them,it)> as many times as you like!

Txt_Item_Use_Count_common2.Text: Oh, just so you know, you can use this staff as many times as you like!

Txt_Item_Use_Count_common3.Text: The best thing about <IfPlrNoun_I_NAME(these,this)> is you can use <IfPlrNoun_I_NAME(them,it)> as many times as you like!

Txt_Item_Use_Count_common4.Text: Just remember: you can only use <IfPlrNoun_I_NAME(these,this)> once and then <IfPlrNoun_I_NAME(they're,it's)> gone for good.

Txt_Item_Use_Count_common5.Text: Just so you know: <IfPlrNoun_I_NAME(these,this)>'ll be gone for good if you use <IfPlrNoun_I_NAME(them,it)>.

Txt_Item_Use_Count_Dieamend.Text: This shatters into a million shards when it saves your life.

Txt_Item_Use_Count_Prayer_Ring.Text:
Be wise about when you choose to use this; it has a habit of breaking after it's been called upon a certain number of times.<KEY_WAIT>
In fact, some people just wear it without ever using it. I can see why; it is rather fetching.

Txt_Item_Use_Count_Words_Of_Wisdom.Text: This'll up and vanish once read, so be sure you've picked the right person to make a sage before perusing it.

Oh dear. Something tells me <IfPlrNoun_I_NAME(these are,this is)> trouble...<KEY_WAIT>

Txt_Item_Curse_Guide3.Text: Hmm, <IfPlrNoun_I_NAME(they don't,this doesn't)> seem to be cursed at least. Feel free to equip <IfPlrNoun_I_NAME(them,it)> if you like!

<Cap><DefSgl_ACTOR> puts on <DefSgl_I_NAME> and appeals to the heavens...<KEY_WAIT>
<SE>[SYSSE_HEAL]<Cap><DefSgl_TARGET> recovers MP!

<Cap><DefSgl_ACTOR> mashes up <DefSgl_I_NAME> and administers it to <DefSgl_TARGET>.<KEY_WAIT>

Txt_Item_Field_Use_Effective_1_Fail_Is_A.Text:
<Cap><DefSgl_TARGET> thumbs through the pages of <Sgl_I_NAME>...<KEY_WAIT>
The author's dogged refusal to admit that anyone is better than him fills <DefSgl_TARGET> with admiration!<KEY_WAIT>
<IfGender_TARGET(He,She,It)> is suddenly unable to bear the thought of losing!

Txt_Item_Field_Use_Effective_1_The_Sadde.Text:
<Cap><DefSgl_TARGET> thumbs through the pages of <Sgl_I_NAME>...<KEY_WAIT>
The tragic tales within reduce <IfGender_TARGET(him,her,it)> to a blubbering wreck.<KEY_WAIT>
<Cap><DefSgl_TARGET> is now in touch with <IfGender_TARGET(his,her,its)> most sickly-sweet and sentimental side!

Txt_Item_Field_Use_Effective_1_Tears_Bef.Text:
<Cap><DefSgl_TARGET> thumbs through the pages of <Sgl_I_NAME>...<KEY_WAIT>
The book contains lots of tricks and secrets for making people spoil you rotten.<KEY_WAIT>
Inspired by the contents, <DefSgl_TARGET> becomes an insufferable brat!

Txt_Item_Field_Use_Effective_1_Loving_Li.Text:
<Cap><DefSgl_TARGET> thumbs through the pages of <Sgl_I_NAME>...<KEY_WAIT>
<6>Good luck and bad luck are mere constructs. Change your outlook, and your luck, too, will change.<9><KEY_WAIT>
The scales fall from <DefSgl_TARGET>'s eyes, and suddenly the secrets of getting 110% out of life are clear to <IfGender_TARGET(him,her,it)>!

Txt_Item_Field_Use_Effective_1_Comedy_Bo.Text:
<Cap><DefSgl_TARGET> thumbs through the pages of <Sgl_I_NAME>...<KEY_WAIT>
The importance of humour in even the most sombre situations suddenly becomes abundantly clear.<KEY_WAIT>
<Cap><DefSgl_TARGET> resolves to be a ray of sunshine and a breath of fresh air, no matter the occasion!

Txt_Item_Field_Use_Effective_1_Diary_Of_.Text:
<Cap><DefSgl_TARGET> thumbs through the pages of <Sgl_I_NAME>...<KEY_WAIT>
Simple illustrations teach the reader how to maximise their physical development through intense exercise.<KEY_WAIT>
<Cap><DefSgl_TARGET> is now all gains, no brains.

Txt_Item_Field_Use_Effective_1_The_Girls.Text:
<Cap><DefSgl_TARGET> thumbs through the pages of <Sgl_I_NAME>...<KEY_WAIT>
The stories inside bring back fond childhood memories...<KEY_WAIT>
<Cap><DefSgl_TARGET> resolves to relive the carefree days of <IfGender_TARGET(his,her,its)> youth!

Txt_Item_Field_Use_Effective_1_Cheater_B.Text:
<Cap><DefSgl_TARGET> thumbs through the pages of <Sgl_I_NAME>...<KEY_WAIT>
The message of the book seems to be that any amount of craftiness is acceptable if it's for the sake of those we love.<KEY_WAIT>
<Cap><DefSgl_TARGET> suddenly realises that the wiliness within <IfGender_TARGET(him,her,it)> is nothing to be ashamed of!

Txt_Item_Field_Use_Effective_1_Benice_Bo.Text:
<Cap><DefSgl_TARGET> thumbs through the pages of <Sgl_I_NAME>...<KEY_WAIT>
The author talks at great length about the power of kindness, which really strikes a chord with <DefSgl_TARGET>.<KEY_WAIT>
